In 2010, Men Gel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Men Gel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Men Gel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be Men Gel's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

location.town: Santo Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Emmanuella

texts.en: Emmanuella is 38 years old. She has two children who are 5 and 3 years old. Her older child attends school, but her younger child is not yet in school. For the past seven years, Emmanuella has operated a business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell. With the profits from her business, she plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 58-year-old married woman with 11 children. Her oldest child is already 41 years old.

Cecilia is engaged in farming. She grows rice and corn crops. She sells her harvest to the community. Cecilia works hard to improve her business and provide for her family.

Cecilia's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem is 42 years old and married to S. A., who operates a cosmetics shop in a nearby market. Through his shop, he offers cosmetics to his customers at cheap rates. 

Tasleem is a very supportive woman who assists her husband financially by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She receives regular orders from her community ladies and fulfills them on time to earn an income. 

She belongs to a small city of Punjab, Pakistan called Khanewal. She has been living there in a 2 room brick house with her family for the past 15 years. 
She is the mother of a daughter and 4 sons. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver while others are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her sewing business. Through the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her finishing the orders on time and produce quality work. 

She started this business 3 years ago and hopes that an investment will help her by making her business even better. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In every loan year, she has maintained a good credit record and attended every meeting.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a station for washing vehicles

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado is a married man who lives in Banga, South Cotabato with his family. He has 4 children, the oldest of whom is 16 years old.

Conrado is a farmer. He has been growing rice for more than 10 years now and earns approximately PHP 5000 per month. Conrado works hard to provide for his family and sustain his children's education.

Conrado's loan will be used to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is the resident of Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in Jaswant Nagar where she has been living with her family in a 3 room brick house for past 5 years. 

She has a sewing machine with which she sews dresses and sells to her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. She also does embroidery and earns good profits through this skill as well. 

Her husband’s name is M. M. and he has a laundry business. He has contacts with different homes of the areas and offers them clothes washing services for reasonable rates. Sakina has 2 daughters. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy thread, cloth and beads to offer better and timely services to her customers to earn more profits. 

She has been in this business for some time now and hopes that the loan investment will help her further improve her business.

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sakina

loans.use: to buy thread, cloth and beads for her embroidery business

loans.name: Sadafmo

texts.ru: Бобоева Садафмо проживает в районе Варзоб. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее имеются 3 детей. Образование средне – специальное, швея. Она предоставляет услугу, занимается шитьем национальных платьев. В этой области более 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей. Так как на сегодняшний день она шьет и продает национальные платья.
texts.en: Sadafmo B. lives in the Varzob region. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She has a vocational education as a seamstress. She offers a service sewing traditional dresses. She has been doing this work for more than twenty years.  She is taking out a loan to buy fabric.  Today, she sews and sells traditional dresses.

loans.use: to buy fabric used to sew traditional dresses

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 34 years. She has 5 children who are between the ages of 3 and 5. Her husband sells different kinds of merchandise. Alphonsine owns a shop in which she sells different food stuffs such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Alphonsine is requesting a loan to buy more items and fill her shop and make more profits. She plans to pay her children school fees with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em Soklin, 32, has been a recycling buyer since 2000, and she always rides her old bicycle to buy all kinds of old things. She earns an income of approximately $3.25 per day, 

Her husband works growing a rice crop on his own farm, and he can get an income of about $1 per day. 

These two try their best to work. They have been married for many years, but they don’t have children yet. 

She would use this loan to purchase used goods to stock up for resale and to buy a new ladder to replace the broken one. The loan from Kiva’s partner HKL will increase her daily income. 

She dreams of having a big wooden house and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used goods for resale and to buy a new ladder to replace the broken one

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian is aged 62 and has been in mixed farming for forty years in his hometown of Nkubu in Central Kenya. He is married with five children (all adults). He produces tobacco, coffee, bananas and milk which are all sold locally. He relies on his teaching pension for additional income.

Adrian has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats. He believes he will generate enough income to purchase more farming inputs and better his farming business as well as family living standards. He also aspires to buy more land and build rental houses in future.

Adrian points at prolonged drought as the major challenge for the farming business in the area.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca M. is 27 years old and is single. 

She sells electricity in her business. Prisca works from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day, and she has one year's experience. Her business is well-organized, and she employs one person in her business.
 
Prisca has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more office supplies like computers, paper and so on.

She will reinvest any profits in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more office supplies like computer, paper and so on

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en: Battogtoh lives with his parents, brother and sisters in Zavhan province of Mongolia. His father is retired and gets 105,000 MNT per month. His mother works at a medical center and her monthly salary is 210,000 MNT. His brother works in a local company, Delger, and makes 120,000 MNT a month.  Battogtoh goes to Mongolian State University of Agriculture in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia and is majoring in engineering. He will graduate his university in June 2012. He is a modest person and says, "After graduating my University, I would like to work and help my parents." Battogtoh is requesting a loan of 400,000 MNT to pay his tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en:
Hrachik G. is 26 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village, an area of Sevan, with his wife and his father. 

Since 2005 Hrachik has been engaged in farming. On his farm he raises cows and calves, pigs and chickens. His wife and father help him in this occupation and thus they provide for their family’s needs. Hrachik purposes to develop his farm and thereto he is seeking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some more cows for his farm.

loans.use: To buy some more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru: Шукуров Махмадшариф проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 53 года. Он женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Махмадшариф предоставляет услугу, такси. Он развозит людей по маршруту Гулбутта-Душанбе. В этой сфере имеет богатый опыт, так как он более 15 лет водит машину. Кредит берет для ремонта машины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Mahmadsharif S. lives in Dushanbe.  He is 53 years old. He is married, with five children. His wife is a homemaker. Mahmadsharif provides taxi services. He transports passengers along the route between Gulbutta und Dushanbe. He has a lot of experience as he has been a driver for over 15 years. He is taking out a loan in order to repair his car and provide a safe driving service.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Kpoti Yivu

texts.fr: Monsieur  Yivu est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est âgé de 39 ans et habite quartier Bè-Souza. Il exerce comme activité la photocopie. Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2002  et s’approvisionne à la société NEACOM-PS.  Aussi il a reçu de Wages 5 prêts  qu’il a bien remboursé déjà. Ensuite il satisfait les clients dans une boutique à côté de la pharmacie des étoiles. Il demande un prêt pour acheter une photocopieuse et de ce fait satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Yivu is married with four children. He is 39 years old, and he lives in the district of Bè-Souza. 

He works in the photocopy business, an activity started in 2002. He gets his supplies from a company called NEACOM-PS. He received five previous loans from WAGES, all fully repaid.  He conducts his business in a shop located next to the pharmacy. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase a copier and satisfy more customers.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more milk preserving containers and manure.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Олимова Дилором проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж работает в милиции, он милиционер. Сама Дилором занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает женское нижнее белье, детскую одежду и обувь, то есть у нее смешанный ассортимент товара. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Dilorom O. lives in Shahrituz. She is 37 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband works in the police department as a policeman. Dilorom works trading in the market. She sells an assortment of goods including women’s underwear, and children's clothes and shoes. She has been doing this for ten years.  She is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods for resale

loans.name: Veng

texts.en:
Veng A., 55, sells porridge in the province of Siem Reap, making a profit of approximately $6 each day. Veng doesn’t have a life partner because she has been divorced from her husband for several years, and now lives with her two single children. There is no additional income from her children, but her nephew works delivering boats and earns A. income of around $3 each day.

Veng is going to use her loA. from Kiva to open a grocery kiosk selling a variety of products. This will enable her family to accrue extra profits to meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: to open a grocery kiosk selling a variety of products

loans.name: Erkingul's Group

texts.en:
Erkingul J., 45, is a leader of this group. As Kyrgyzstan is in the heart of the historically know Silk Road, the master of eastern trade techniques are still left in Kyrgyz blood. Erkingul is a resident of the town of Tup and has three children. Her oldest son is employed in neighboring Kazakhstan, while the other two children are busy with their studies. 

In 2006 Erkingul took a loan in a local bank and opened her own retail shop. The secret of her success is that she is very sensitive to customers’ tastes and expectations. She almost never has leftover goods. Her monthly profit has reached 10 000 soms. Erkingul applied for this loan because she needs to stock her retail shop with large amounts of goods such as beverages. In the future she hopes to increase the goods circulation to 200 000 soms and to assist her son in purchasing a house. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods.

loans.name: Upol's Group

texts.en:
Upol A., 63, is a leader of this group. She and the members of her group are the residents of the small town of Tup, the main activity of which is cattle breeding and raising crops. Despite her age, she stays energetic and enthusiastic with her business. Upol’s husband relies on his pension, so he also makes contributions in feeding, raising and selling the cattle. Upol is happy with her accomplishments, since she’s a proud mother of five kids and a respected veteran in cattle breeding. Her youngest son gains experience from her and learns all techniques very quickly. The roots of this business appeared in 2005 when the family sold all their crops from the land and spent the proceeds on purchasing cattle. For now, a monthly profit from the business is 4,000 soms. Upol’s final goal is to reach 15 heads of cattle in her household. She’s confidently stepping towards the goal. With the loan from Kiva, she plans to purchase two cattle. 

        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.ru: Алиева Лутфия жительница Шахритусского района. Ей 50 лет. Она Разведена. У нее 3 детей. Сын находится в России на заработках. Сама Лутфия имеет средне - специальное образование, медсестра. По специальности проработала 10 лет. Сейчас она занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает однотонные материалы с вышивками. И еще она продает штаны и специальные ткани для вышивки. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки ниток и материалов с вышивкой.
texts.en: Lutfiya A. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is fifty years old, divorced, and has three children. Her son is working in Russia. Lutfiya has a vocational education as a nurse. She worked in her profession for ten years.  Now she is works in trade. She rents a shop where she sells embroidered monochromatic fabrics. She also sells trousers and special fabrics for embroidering. She has been doing this work for five years.  She is taking out a loan to buy thread and fabric for embroidery.

loans.use: to purchase thread and fabric for embroidery.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik A. is 53 years old and lives in Tsovagyugh village, in the Sevan area, with his wife. Norik’s children are already adults and they live separately from their parents. 

For about 10 years Norik worked as a bricklayer. Now Norik and his wife run their own farm, where they breed cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Thanks to the farm income, Norik and his wife support themselves and their farm. For his farm development, Norik asks for a 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy two cows and some sheep.

loans.use: To buy two cows and some sheep.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is a 37-year-old married woman. She has no kids yet but she hopes to have kids soon.

She is a farmer who helps her husband till their land in Banga, South Cotabato, where they also live. They grow rice and corn to sell to the community. She also manages their sari-sari store where they sell soy sauce, detergent soap, and various other products.

Edelyn's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon, aged 63, is a father of eight.  All his children are now adults save one, aged sixteen, who is still in school. He lives with his family in their hometown of Nkubu in Central Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for over ten years, producing tea, milk, vegetables and maize, which he sells locally. He has always relied on farming for income.

Gideon has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes the family will get adequate milk for domestic consumption, and some surplus to generate additional income for other needs. He hopes to acquire two more cows and to make his farming more commercial, however he laments about low market prices and animal diseases, which eat into his farming income.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jamiyla

texts.en:
Jamiyla R., 34, is a farmer and married with five children. Her husband Mederbek helps her and also supports the family by working as a builder. Her family has been engaged in breeding cattle and land cultivation since 1998. They started it with 30,000 KGS of capital and managed to raise it to profits of 5,000 KGS a month from selling milk products and harvest. Today, Jamiyla’s farm consists of two milk cows, twenty sheep and one horse. In order to broaden her farm, Jamiyla has applied for a loan of 80,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenues, she plans to pay for the education of her children. Jamiyla is a very purposeful person with the motto, "Moving ahead without stopping" and she makes every effort to implement this into her family’s life.

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan, use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment, meeting the interests of both clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Akos Mawusse

texts.fr: Madame Mawusse  est mariée  avec un enfant à charge.  Elle est née en 1987 à Agou et habite quartier Hedzranawoé. Elle fait le commerce de  produit générique à côté du marché local de Hedzranawoé.  Elle a commencé en 2006 et achète ces produits au Ghana à Accra. Elle espère augmenter son commerce et sollicite un crédit pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Mrs. E. is married with one dependent child.  She was born in 1987 at Agou and lives in the Hedzranawoé district.  She sells generic products next to the Hedzranawoé local market.  She started this business in 2006 and buys her products in Ghana at Accra.  She hopes to grow her business and is requesting a loan to stock up.

loans.use: To buy generic products

loans.name: Turdukan's Group

texts.en:
Turdukan K., 30, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of a small village, Bokonbaevo, and is married to a farmer. She is also a mother of three school-aged children, and together with her husband she runs a business of cattle reselling. Turdukan buys young calves, fattens them, and resells them at a higher price. The profits allow her to cover all the food costs and family expenses. The start-up capital was 3,000 soms four years ago, and now the profits from the business reach 10,000 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds and lubricating fluid for farming equipment, because she wants to start cultivating land. 


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---


This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and lubricating fluid for farming equipment

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.ru: Бубиев Абдулхамид проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 33 года. Он женат. Имеет троих детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдулхамид занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. Он в основном продает мужскую одежду, то есть брюки, футболки и майки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 3 года. Кредит берет для покупки оптом летних футболок.
texts.en: Abdulhamid B. lives in Shahrituz.  He is 33 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Abdulhamid trades in the region’s central market. He principally sells men's wear: trousers, T-shirts and vests. He has been doing this work for three years.  He is taking out a loan to buy summer T-shirts wholesale.

loans.use: to buy summer T-shirts wholesale.

loans.name: Nafing

texts.fr:
Madame NAFING D. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée  et mère  de 3 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une grande famille traditionnelle au  quartier Médine de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, (analphabétisme des parents), elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments au marché de Pelengana. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle  évolue seule  en menant beaucoup d’activités (vente de jus, d’habits, de chaussures et d’huiles alimentaires). Elle mène ces activités depuis 17  ans et   jouit d’une grande clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses articles, mais également à son prix abordable et son sérieux dans le recouvrement.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice. Elle  a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 54 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels correctement bien remboursés. Elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 10 bidons de 20 litres d’huiles et 5 pièces de bazins moins riches. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso.
Madame NAFING D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle espère  de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari  et de participer à des événements sociaux.  Elle ambitionne  de  construire  une maison et de faire progresser son activité.
texts.en:
Madame NAFING D. is 34 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband in a large traditional family in the Médine district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 
Unable to attend school because of social circumstances (her parents were illiterate), she went to work to earn money alongside her mother who sold condiments in the market in Pelengana.  After several years of learning, she began doing many different types of work on her own (selling juice, clothing, shoes and cooking oils). She has been doing this work for 17 years and enjoys a large clientele.  Her healthy sales are due to the quality of her merchandise, but also because of her reasonable prices and seriousness in collecting her money. 
In hopes of building up her business, and to increase her profits, she has applied at Soro Yiriwaso.  She has been involved with them for 54 months, having taken out 3 joint loans and 3 individual loans, all correctly repaid.  She is on her fourth individual loan with which she plans to buy 10 20-liter cans of oil and 5 lengths of lesser quality fabric.  She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso.
Madame NAFING D. sells for cash and for credit to a clientele of women and men.
With this loan, she hopes to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA.  These earnings will allow her to help her husband and to participate in social events.  Her ambition is to build a house and to grow her business.
.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and clothing

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en:
Kochkorka is one of many villages that keep a vast variety of animals including sheep, goats, cows and horses. Kyrgyz people are proud of their horsemanship. It is often said that Kyrgyz boys learn to ride before they can walk. Cattle and other animals have played a tremendous role in Kyrgyz culture and history since nomadic times. Anarkul A., 54, is the leader of this group. A proud mother of five children, she values animals like her own family. Her mother taught her to have a tender attitude towards animals so that they, in turn, can feel and reward you with help in hard times.

Anarkul's husband coaches in a local sports school and devotes his entire free time to helping Anarkul feed the cattle and take them to a cattle yard. Their children are no longer financially dependent on Anarkul and her husband. The reselling of cattle allows the couple to cover their daily expenses and improve home comforts. The idea originated two years ago, thanks to the advice of close friends, well-trained cattle breeders. The couple borrowed some funds to start up the business. They later earned enough to repay their debts in time. Now that the business allows her to cover her costs, Anarkul gathered together this group, which she believes deserves financial assistance from Kiva lenders. Anarkul is a very responsible and self-organized leader who promises to repay the loan on time. Her personal purpose for the loan is to purchase extra heads of cattle for further resale. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 53-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and 9 children. Ibrahim has owned an  entertainment shop since 2005, where friends, neighbors and relatives come and spend joyful time playing billiards. He also owns a small grocery store, catering to the same clientele. He used to work as a taxi driver but he insisted on changing his family's way of living by changing his business. Ibrahim is requesting his first  loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his grocery store capital and to add new entertainment machines to his shop. Ibrahim hopes to expand his business by adding more games such as Play Stations.

loans.use: to add new entertainment machines

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame  KADIATOU K.  est âgée de 36 ans, mariée  et mère  d’un enfant.  Elle  vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Bamanankin de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignante de formation, elle commença le commerce en marge des études, auprès de sa mère qui menait des petites activités génératrices de revenus (vente de jus de fruits et d’habits). Nantie de plus d’une décennie d’expériences, elle évolue seule en menant le commerce d’habits et de couvertures draps depuis maintenant 15 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses articles qui sont très prisés mais surtout à son prix abordable.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 54 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés.  Elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 20 complets de brodés et 20 complets de couvertures et draps. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et au Burkina Faso.
Madame  KADIATOU K.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de se prendre en charge et de participer à des événements sociaux.  
Son  ambition est de  construire  une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadiatou K. is 36 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She lives in a nuclear family in the Bamanankin district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A teacher by training, she started a business concurrent with her studies and with the help of her mother, who used to run small-scale revenue-generating businesses (the sale of fruit juices and clothing). 

Bestowed with over a decade of experience, Kadiatou advanced on her own, running a business involving clothing, blankets, and bedsheets for fifteen years now. She enjoys a great reputation and customer base. Her selling power is due to the quality of her goods, which are very popular, but especially due to her affordable prices.

With plans to increase her working capital, in order to make more profit, she turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has had an association with Soro Yiriwaso for 54 months, after three solidarity loans and three individual loans, which were all repaid properly. She is now on her fourth individual loan, which she plans on using to buy 20 embroidered outfits and 20 sets of blankets and sheets. She gets her supplies in Bamako and in Burkina Faso. 

Accepting cash or credit, Kadiatou sells to a customer base composed of women and men. With this loan, she envisions making monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. The profits will enable her to support herself and to help with societal events. Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy clothing, blankets, and bedsheets

loans.name: Upol's Group

texts.en:
Upol I., 69, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of the small village of Kochkorka and has three children, the youngest of whom is 8 years old. Her oldest son helps her in cattle breeding and in feeding and taking the cattle to the closest cattle market. Upol initiated and started the business 19 years ago with an initial capital of about 10,000 KGS. The investment was not in vain because nowadays the return is 5,000 KGS per month. The profits helped Upol purchase home appliances and increase the number of cattle. Upol applied for this loan in order to purchase additional heads of cattle. In the future, she would like to use the returns from the business to finish construction of a temporary structure.


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Indira's Group

texts.en:
Indira M., 23, is the leader of this group. Recently, her friend advised her to join a company producing beauty products. Indira is very interested in the beauty industry and its potential and therefore immediately accepted the offer. Indira is a consultant salesperson, whose responsibilities are to promote the product and attract a large amount of customers. Indira knows all the innovations in the company’s products and provides catalogs to her friends and other potential customers through door-to-door sales. She has her own team and receives bonuses for providing services for customers on a regular basis. Her main goal is to ensure customer satisfaction with a product and to get more profits. She applied for a loan in order to invest funds in ordering more products. Indira sees her future with a further partnership with this company and with increased income.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Momosuluv

texts.ru: Махмудова Момосулув проживает в районе Кубодиён. Ей 58 лет. Замужем, имеет 10 детей. У нее большая и дружная семья. Муж работает в двух дехканских хозяйствах. Сама Момосулув занимается растениеводством. Она арендует участок земли, где выращивает овощи, сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 6 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян арбуза и минеральных удобрений для сезонного посева.
texts.en: Momosuluv M. lives in the Qubadiyon district.  She is 58 years old, married and has 10 children.  She has a big and happy family.  Her husband works at two dekhan farms.  Momosuluv is involved in agriculture.  She leases a plot of land, where she grows vegetables and plants fruit trees.  She has been involved in this business for 6 years.  The goal of this loan is a purchase of watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizers for the seasonal sowing.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizers for seasonal sowing

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha A. was born in 1969. He lives in the village of Tsovagyugh, in the Sevan area, with his wife and his 13-year-old son. Misha has engaged in animal breeding since 1990. With his wife’s help, he raises cows, calves, sheep and chickens. Thanks to his income from farming, Misha provides for his family’s needs. 
Misha needs a 350,000 AMD loan to buy one more cow for his farm.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm

loans.name: Bermet's Group

texts.en:
Bermet A., 53, is the leader of this group. She and her husband, a pensioner, have a small dairy business. They have had to work hard their entire lives, mostly in low-skilled, physically exhausting jobs. They dreamed of having a dairy farm of their own and living peacefully, watching after the livestock and drinking fresh milk.

Ten years ago, the couple's dream showed the first signs of becoming a reality. They saved sizable funds and bought their first dairy cow. This purchase was very overwhelming and meaningful for Bermet’s belief and motivation. Now the business has several heads of cattle and generates a profit of 2,000 KGS monthly and up to 3-4 liters of milk daily, which is further sold for 11 KGS per liter. It’s been ten years since the start of the business, and the couple helped organize a nice wedding ceremony for their daughter. Bermet's short term goals include purchasing 2 sheep in order to diversify the household. Bermet believes in Kiva lenders’ assistance to reach this goal. Bermet's long-term goal and big wish is to build a big shed for her cattle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia H. M., 58, is married to H. M. and they have been blessed with five children. She runs a hotel in Likoni and has been in this business for the last ten years. This marks her second loan from KADET and she plans to purchase a sack of rice, maize meal and tomatoes and to add more chairs and tables to her business. The additional profit will be used to renovate the hotel. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice, maize meal and tomatoes and to add more chairs and tables to her business.

loans.name: Kageni

texts.en:
Kageni E. G., 51, is married with six children, three of whom are still in school. She has been in the agriculture industry for the last ten years and gets good returns from her harvest. 

Kageni has been a good client who repays her loans without any complications. This will be her third loan with KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase farming supplies. She hopes to generate income from the loan which she can use to build a permanent house for her family.

In the future, Kageni hopes she will live a better life and see her children prosper.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa O. M., 35, is married to Paulina M. and they have three children. He lives in Narok, Kenya and he has been in cash crop farming for the last eight years.

Musa is a humble client who knew KADET through other clients in his area of residence. This will be his first loan with KADET and he intends to spend the loan proceeds to prepare land for farming. He plans to reinvest the anticipated profits back into the farm. He dreams of becoming a big farmer.

Musa can do more if provided with the resources.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of farm produce.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. Musa is 32 years old and married. Her husband is a mechanic and they have six chidren aged between 8 months and 17 years old. Mary has been selling chicken to the local people for 15 years. Her business is located in the town center known as Athi River. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business going well. Mary is using her loan of KES 10,000 to add more chicks to develop her business and to meet her customers' demands. She hopes to expand her business and diversify to a food kiosk. She describes herself as determined and innovative.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is 37 years old and is married with two children. Her husband, Antony Karita, is 38 and works with BHC. Their oldest child, Leri, is 10 years old and attends lower school and their youngest, Leon, is four years old and in pre-school.

Agnes runs a clothing boutique that is located in the town center. Her business provides a monthly profit of 25,000 KES.  Agnes was introduced to KADET by a group that was already registered. This is her first loan with KADET and she will use it to purchase men’s suits, shirts and ties. 

Agnes describes herself hardworking and honest. If this loan boosts her business, she plans to purchase a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase men’s suits, shirts and ties

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Гулова Зулфия проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Она четыре года как занимается торговлей. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает детскую одежду, женские штаны и нижнее белье. Ее муж тоже занимается торговлей. Она берет кредит для покупки детской одежды и женского нижнего белья.
texts.en: Zulfiya G. lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 45 years old, married and has one child.  She has been involved in retail sales for four years.  Zulfiya has a retail outlet, where she sells children's clothing, women's pants and undergarments.  Her husband is also involved in retail sales.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of children's clothing and women's undergarments.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing and women's undergarments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 34 years old and single. He has a mixed farm in Litein town, Rift Valley Kenya that produces milk and tea. He has been in the farming business for ten years now and employs one farmhand. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to expand his business. He faces the challenges of poor roads and not enough food for his animals.  He would like to improve his dairy farming business in future by building a dairy unit and planting more pastures.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 32 years old married man, living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and three kids. Youssef is a hard worker like any married man who runs more than one business in order to provide for his family. Youssef has owned a grocery store since 2001; he also owns an internet cafe where local teenagers spend time socializing. 

Youssef is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business capital.  He has been a Al Majmoua borrower since 2009, and his repayment schedule is more than perfect. He loves his family a lot and wants to provide the best education for his kids since he was unable to complete his education.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his new opened grocery store

loans.name: Clenda

texts.en:
Clenda is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya.  Clenda is 24 years old and married with two children ages 2 and 4 years.  She has been in the farming business for six years and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk to the local market. 

She has requested for a loan of 25,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable her to pay school fees for her child. Her primary challenge has been lack of enough animal feed. She hopes to acquire at least 4 dairy cows in the next five years.
She would like Juhudi to help her look for quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mirley Yaneth

texts.es:
Después de separarse de su esposo, Mirley Yaneth A. C., buscó la manera de cubrir sus gastos, fue entonces cuando decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de helados y así salir adelante. 

Actualmente, Mirley necesita de un préstamo para comprar más productos y así ampliar su oferta y captar más clientes, pues cada vez le piden más variedad. 

En el futuro esta emprendedora sueña con tener una charcutería para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
After separating from her husband, Mirley Yaneth A. C. looked for a way to cover her expenses.  It was then that she decided to start her own business and sell ice cream so that she could get ahead.

Currently Mirley needs a loan to buy more products and thus enlarge her selection so that she can attract more customers.  They are always asking for a greater variety.

In the future this entrepreneurial woman dreams of having a delicatessen to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more food products

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 27 year old single man.  He owns and has been operating his veterinary medicine pharmacy for 4 years.

He is requesting a loan to buy more medicine and make more profits.
He plans to save some of the profit he hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy veterinary medicine for his pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming inputs and pay laborers on her potato farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase salon equipment, relaxers, treatments etc

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Chean S. lives with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its ancient temples. She makes a living raising pigs and earns about $2 a day. Her husband is a farmer, and earns about $1 a day. Each month, the family spends $40 on food and $40 on other necessities. S. is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income she earns to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 48 years old. She has three children who are between 13 and 25 years old. They are all in school.

Mediatrice owns a shop in which she sells different kinds of flour and other kinds of items. She is requesting a loan to buy different items for her shop and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam V. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. V. is a weaver, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 1.50 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 55 on other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce silk products.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen P. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. P. is a weaver, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 55 on other necessary expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce silk products.

loans.name: Roger Daniel

texts.es: solicitante 25 años de edad es soltero y vive en casa de su padre. Cuenta con negocio de transporte(mototaxi) el cual uno de ellos es alquilado y el otro es trabajado por el, experiencia en el rubro hace 3años. Cuenta con credito vigente en scotiabank el fue destinado para la compra de un auto tico el cual esta a nombre de su madre, quien firma como aval en el presente credito .solicita credito para mantenimiento de las movilidades. goza de buenas refefencias personales. se propone el credito por tener capacidad y voluntad de pago
texts.en: This loan applicant is 25 years old. He is single and lives in his father's house. He has a motorcycle-taxi transportation business. One of his taxis is rented out and he drives the other for work. He has three years of experience in this business. He has a current loan at Scotiabank, which is destined for the purchase of a Daewoo Tico; this loan is in the name of his mother, who signed as the guarantor for this loan. He is applying for a loan to maintain his vehicles. He enjoys good personal references. He is recommended for the loan because he has the ability and will to make the payments.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicles.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem S., 40, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. S. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 33 on food and USD 50 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub S., 57, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband produces wooden furniture to sell, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 90 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more wood to produce wooden furniture. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. S. appears in the photograph with her husband's furniture.

loans.use: to buy more wood to produce wooden furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary wood and and iron rods

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long R. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. R. rents out houses, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 50 on other necessary expenses. R. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to build more rooms to rent. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to build more rooms for rent.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok K. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. K. is a trainer of traditional dancers, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband sells groceries, earning an income of about USD 7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 80 on other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. K. appears in the photograph in front of her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a fifty-year married man with six children .He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer and also distills alcohol. Andrew started with three acres of banana trees which he used to make alcohol. Later he diversified into maize growing. He dreams of educating his children and buying a car to help him in business. Andrew wants a loan to plant maize and pay for labour.

loans.use: to plant maize and pay labourers.

loans.name: Fortaleciendo Familias Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Fortaleciendo Familias” y está conformado por 20 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Villarrica. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros, específicamente, la venta de leña, abarrotes, ropa usada y nueva.
Virginia es la presidenta del banco y se encuentra en la foto en la primera fila, segunda del lado derecho, tiene cabello corto, usa anteojos y está un poco inclinada. Ella se dedica a la picaduría y venta de leña. Además transporta y distribuye la leña en su camioneta a sus clientes, que son muchos. 
Con éste préstamo comprará más leña, que la adquiere de los sectores rurales, en el campo específicamente. 
Sus metas son cambiarse de domicilio, ya que vive a 5 mil kilómetros de Villarrica, lo que le dificulta en su vida cotidiana, ya que debe trasladarse en camioneta y se encarecen todos sus gastos. Por ende sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, ya que éste le permitirá generar más ganancias y por ende concretará su proyecto. 
Virginia está muy agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo esperanza, además se siente muy contenta con las reuniones, ya que son muy amenas y disfruta mucho de la compañía de los demás emprendedores. 
Villarrica es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios del área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Pucón. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Strengthening Families” and it is made up of twenty members that live in the city of Villarica. Each member has a different occupation such as selling firewood, groceries, used and new clothes, etc.
Virginia is the president of the bank. You can see her in the front line in the photo. She is the second one on the right. She has short hair, wears glasses and is kneeling a bit. She works buying and selling firewood. She also transports and distributes firewood in her pick-up truck to her customers, of which there are many. 
With this loan she will buy more firewood, which she buys in the rural sector, more specifically, in the countryside. 
Her goal is to move to a new house, as she lives five kilometers outside of Villarica. This causes difficulties in her daily life, as she has to commute in her truck and pay for all of these expenses. Nevertheless she would like to continue with her business, as it allows her to generate earnings and thus reach her goals.
Virginia is thankful for the loan that will be provided from a long distance. She is very happy with the meetings at the bank as they are very nice and she enjoys the company of the other business people.
Villarica is a city in southern Chile, located in the Araucania region. It is a small city but it has basic and tourist services. It is one of the main centers of the lumber industry and is a tourist attraction as it is near Pucón (where there is a famous lake and the Villarica volcano). During the summer months there are numerous activities and cultural, artistic and sporting events. Also it is a popular spot for ecotourism, adventure tourism and ethno tourism.

loans.use: To buy fuel/firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional mechanical tools and machineries

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is currently in the business of selling cooking oil. She is 30 years old, married to a businessman, and has two children -- one child goes to school.

Charity borrowed a loan to buy more cooking oil to sell. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
La falta de oportunidades laborales y la necesidad de generar ingresos para contribuir al cubrimiento de los gastos familiares, obligaron a María Ofelia G. C. a iniciar su negocio, una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar que puso en la sala de su casa. 

Desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, María Ofelia abre las puertas de su negocio con la esperanza de vender cada vez más. Actualmente esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido y así incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida, pues a sus 56 años espera tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en: Lack of work opportunities and the need to create an income to cover household expenses forced Maria Ofelia Gonzalez C. to start her business; a store she has out of her livingroom selling household goods.  From 8AM to 10PM, Maria Ofelia opens her doors for business with the hopes of increasing sales each time.  Currently, this entrepreneur needs a loan to purchase supply and increase sales and improve her quality of life.  At her 56 years of age she hopes to have a peaceful retirement.

loans.use: to purchase supply

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria Elena H. Martínez quien es estilista tuvo la idea de dedicarse a la venta de productos relacionados con la belleza con el propósito de contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues su esposo quien trabaja en una empresa de la ciudad no gana lo suficiente para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. 

Debido a la situación, Gloria Elena se dio a la tarea de trabajar en su propio negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Gloria necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones básicas al negocio y comprar algunos productos que le hacen falta para ofrecer mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena H. M., who is a beautician, decided to sell beauty products as well to contribute to the family’s expenses. Her husband works at a company in the city but does not earn enough to cover all the family’s needs. Because of this situation, Gloria Elena started her own business to improve her family’s quality of life. 

She needs the loan to make some improvements in the business and to buy more products to offer a greater variety.

loans.use: to buy variety of products.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent M. is a married lady. Her husband works with Kenya Power and Lightning Company, and they have two children aged 12 years old and 3 years old. Her business is located at Mukuru Kwa Njenga and she is served by Kitengela branch. 

She owns a general store known by the name Byfaith General shop in which she sells such things as sugar, wheat, flour, beverages, detergents, etc. She has been in this business for seven years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are other people in the area doing the same business as hers, so customers are not loyal as they have plenty of choices. 

However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to add stock to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand it to wholesale and open another shop. She also sees herself building a house for her family. She describes herself as business-minded and ambitious.

loans.use: to stock more sugar, flour, cereals and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university education fees.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.es: Sandy, es natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 21 años de edad, es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, convive con Emiliano de 26 años y fruto de esa relación hoy tienen 02 hijos y  juntos viven en su propia casa, situado en la comunidad de Ivankiriari caserío del distrito de Quimbiri. Desde muy pequeña Sandy aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra plantas de cacao, café y plantaciones de hojas de coca; las cuales lleva a vender  sus productos a los centros de acopio ubicados en los distritos de San Francisco y Quimbiri. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que los meses de su arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos por el cual recibe buenos pagos por sus granos de café, cacao y hojas de coca. Lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas quienes se encargan de  dañar sin piedad a las mazorcas. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de semillas de café y cacao. Su meta a futuro es comprarse nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es su primer crédito de Sandy con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao y café para luego poblar sus campos.
texts.en:
Sandy is from the city of Quimbiri. She is a 21 year old happy and hard working woman. She lives with her common-law partner, Emiliano, who is 26 years old. They have two children and live in their own house located in the community of Ivankiriari, village of the District of Quimbiri.

Her parents showed her how to work in the plantation from a young age. They taught her everything necessary to obtain good crops. She now has her own land which she tills with love and patience. She sells her products to the warehouses in the Districts of San Francisco and Quimbiri. What she likes the best about her work is the harvest because she sees the results of months of hard work by obtaining high quality coffee and cocoa grains and coca leaves. These crops bring in good income. She has been doing this work for four years and feels that the most difficult part is protecting the crops from pests.

She plans to buy coffee and cocoa seeds. One of her future goals is to buy more land to increase her plantation. This is Sandy’s first loan from MFP and she is committed to paying it back in a timely manner since she hopes to obtain another loan in the near future. The loan of 1.500 Nuevos Soles will be used to buy and plant seeds for her plantation.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and coffee seeds.

loans.name: María Iluminada

texts.es:
El desplazamiento por la violencia, ha sido uno de los duros golpes de la vida que maría Iluminada G. M., quien al lado de sus 8 hijos y su esposo se vio obligada a abandonar su tierra. Desde entonces su esposo ha trabajado fuertemente para sacarlos adelante y ella en vista de las necesidades que han debido afrontar ha sido una luchadora incansable pues ha intentado con varios negocios que aunque no han dado resultado en su momento han sido de gran ayuda. 

Actualmente, María Iluminada quien no se da por vencida,  desea intentar nuevamente, esta vez con una tienda de venta de productos de la canasta familiar esperando que esta vez éste pueda perdurar en el tiempo, para ello, necesita de un préstamo para surtir y empezar de nuevo.
texts.en:
María Iluminada had to leave her home, along with her husband and 8 children, because of violence. Her husband has been working very hard in order to get ahead. María, seeing the need that they were facing, and being a hardworking woman, has tried to start several businesses. Even though these businesses weren’t successful, they did help her family greatly at the time.
Actually, María Iluminada has not given up. She would like to start again, this time with a store that sells basic groceries. She hopes that this time the business will be successful. That is why she needs this loan.  She will use the loan money to buy a variety of goods in order to start this new business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of items to be used to start a store

loans.name: Lady Del Rocio

texts.es:
Lady de 21 años, es una joven emprendedora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio. Ya que tiene un aproximado de dos años con su papelería. Quiere seguir trabajando surtiendo la mercadería que vende. 

Su negocio lo inicio con ayuda de su padre y un préstamo que obtuvo en la Fundación. En la actualidad trabaja todo el día vendiendo en su papelería pañales, cuadernos, papelería etc. Uno de sus inconvenientes es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive pero eso no le impide trabajar por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar pañales, cuadernos, papelería y otros artículos. En el futuro ella desea tener una papelería grande y surtida.
texts.en:
Lady is 21 years old and is a young entrepreneur that has a lot of hopes for her business. She has had her stationary store for about two years. She would like to continue expanding the goods that she sells.
She began her business with the help of her father and a loan that she received from the Fundación. She spends every day working in her stationary store selling paper goods, diapers, notebooks, etc. One of the inconveniences of her work is that some of her customers are delinquent with their payments. This doesn’t stop her from working. She would like this loan to buy diapers, notebooks, paper goods and other articles. In the future she would like a bigger stationary store that has a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy diapers, notebooks and paper goods

loans.name: Pay It Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Pay It” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are small-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Marie K.. Marie was born in Kailahun, a town in eastern Sierra Leone about 50 years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader and her children are in college. 

Marie has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells rice, palm-oil, flour, pepper, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, flour, pepper, margi, salt and more in bulk

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es: Ileana de 32 años,  tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general en su vivienda y de manera ambulante desde hace  5 años en la villa cosmapa. Ileana vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Ileana es una mujer realizada y feliz ya que gracias a los ingresos que obtiene de su negocio ha podido colaborarle a su esposo para que sus hijos puedan optar por una vida productiva en este país. Ileana no conforme con esto se siente llena de vida y desea seguir siendo útil y por ello desea reinvertirle a su negocio, para comprar productos con los que no cuenta como lápiz labial, polvos, tratamientos, cremas, bolsos, ropa interior entre otros.
texts.en: Ileana is 32 years old and has a business selling general merchandise from her home and as a street vendor. She has had this business for five years in the town of Cosmapa. She lives with her husband and two young children. Ileana is an accomplished woman and is happy thanks to the revenue she obtains from her business since she has been able to collaborate with her ​​husband so that their children can have a productive life in this country. Ileana, not satisfied with this, feels full of life and wishes to remain useful which is why she wants to reinvest in her business to purchase products that she does not have such as lipsticks, powders, treatments, creams, handbags, lingerie and more.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, powders, treatments, creams, handbags, lingerie and more.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia se dedica al servicio de limpieza, el crédito lo necesita para aumentar el capital de trabajo ya que ella también tiene un puesto de venta de productos variados como por ejemplo: productos de limpieza. Vive  en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada  tiene dos hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo.
texts.en: Mrs. Virginia offers cleaning service. The loan will be used to buy more cleaning products because she also has a store where she sells cleaning products.  She lives in her parent's home which is located in the Bautista Saavedra area in the city of El Alto, is married, and has two children. This is the first time she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy more cleaning products to sell and use in her cleaning service.

loans.name: Unity Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Unity II” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Emmah K. is the leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a mechanic and they have four children. 

Emmah has been a businesswoman for two years now. She sells slippers, rubber bowls, bags, watches, cultural chains, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy slippers, rubber bowls, bags, watches, cultural chains and more at wholesale prices

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: El señor Tomas es profesor en el área rural y su esposa de dedica a la venta de golosinas en un colegio; el crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción. Cemento, arena, vigas, etc., para continuar la construcción de su casa. El anterior crédito lo utilizó para construir habitaciones. Vive en casa propia en la zona de Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto, es Casado y tiene tres hijos. Tomás está intentando mejorar las condiciones de vivienda para su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Tomas is a professor in the rural area and his wife sells sweets in a college. The loan will be used to buy construction material. They need cement, sand, lumber, etc. to continue building their home. The previous loan was used to build homes. He lives in his own home in the Bautista Saavedre area in the city of El Alto, is married, and has three children. Tomas is trying to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, lumber, etc. to continue building their home.

loans.name: Liseth Yamile

texts.es:
A sus 21 años de edad, Liseth TYamile G. D. si sabe lo que es trabajar en la calle, pues desde muy temprana edad, salía a vender bananos en una carreta con su padre y se recorrían las calles de Medellín para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Como ella misma lo afirma Dios es poderoso y fue hace 6 años cuando en una rifa que realizó la Alcaldía de la ciudad se ganaron un local en una Centro Comercial, donde se dedicaron a vender diferentes productos. 

El negocio le permite a Liseth pagar sus estudios y ayudar a cubrir los gastos del hogar, actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido y así mejorara sus ingresos
texts.en:
At 21, Liseth TYamile G. D. knows all about working on the street since she would sell bananas starting at a very young age. She and her father would would sell down the streets of Medellín to cover house payments. She assures that God is powerful since 6 years back she won a raffle in the town hall and the prize was a place in the shopping center. There they sold different products.

This business helps Liseth pay for her education and helps with house payments. At the moment she needs a loan to buy more products to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Gbotima 4 Group

texts.en:
Umo Sherrif is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Umu was born in eastern Sierra Leone about 43 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. 

This is the first loan that Umo and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Umo sells market food – rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc., and has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying rice, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, margi, salt, pepper and more in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: La Nueva Union 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the group coordinator of her group, La Nueva Union 1 & 2 (the New Union), and her story is representative of both the members of her group and also of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated from the DR to Haiti. Her group is based in the area surrounding La Romana,  where the economy is based on the sugar cane industry and where there is little access to running water (none of which is potable) or stable electricity. Maria makes her home with her two children and long-term partner.

Maria has proven herself to be an excellent client of Esperanza and she has successfully repaid four loans. With this new loan, she will purchase flour, meat, oil, and other goods to produce empanadas, a meal of flour filled with meat or vegetables. She has identified a market for these goods among her neighbors and she believes the increased profits will allow her to invest more in her business and save some of the capital. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 26 años, vive en compañía de sus hijos y su madre en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a realizar costuras de faldas y prendas típicas desde hace 3 años, aprendió este oficio por medio de sus amigas y en la actualidad se asoció con su cuñada para comprar maquinas de coser y bordadoras que la ayudan a optimizar el trabajo con mayor calidad y rapidez en su producción. De esta manera ahorra tiempo para atender a su pequeña hija, su horario habitual de trabajo es casi todo el día, dependiendo además de la cantidad de prendas que debe elabora o de los pedidos de los clientes que le hacen para alguna fiesta festiva que se presente en su localidad, cuando es así es donde lleva su producción a los comerciantes de prendas típicas que se encuentran en las ferias. Le agrada bastante su oficio y desea concretar sus proyectos de crecimiento de su negocio. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, gracias a los créditos solicitados en el banco comunal que integra aprendió  el valor importante del ahorro ya que ha visto en su propia experiencia que salva de apuros en momentos de dificultad además de trabajar a gusto con personas que considera de confianza por lo que se siente muy agradecida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos y telas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lidia is 26 years old.  She lives with her children and mother in her parents' home.  Lidia's business is making skirts and traditional clothing and she has been in this business for 3 years.
