She learned the trade from her friends and formed a partnership with her sister-in-law in order to buy sewing machines and embroidery machines which help her to optimize her work, producing better-quality garments more quickly.  This means that she saves time that she can then spend looking after her young daughter.  Lidia's usual work hours are 'nearly all day' but they also depend on the quantity of clothes that she has to make and on orders that her customers make for festive events in their area.  When this is the case, she takes her products to people who sell traditional clothing in the markets.

Lidia enjoys her work and would like to carry out plans to grow her business.  This is her second loan with MFP.  Thanks to the loans requested through her community bank, she has learned the importance of saving since she has witnessed through her own experience how it can help get you out of a tight spot when you are going through a difficult time.  She also enjoys working with people who she trusts and feels very grateful for this.  Lidia will use the loan she is requesting to invest in buying thread and fabric wholesale.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna María se dedica a al destace de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que inicio con este medio de vida. Es una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su negocio, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos por  la buena calidad de cerdos que ofrece. Su esposo labora como agricultor ya que ambos aportan ingresos para su hogar y así mantener a sus 3 hijos a cargo, que todavía están menores de edad. Reyna solicita este crédito para la compra de concentrado, cerdos y otra comida para los cerdos. Su mayor desafío es ampliar su vivienda pues es aquí donde mantiene a sus cerdos y no tiene mucho espacio. Este es su quinto crédito, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante y se siente muy agradecida con la Institución por concederle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Reyna María's business is butchering pigs.  She has been in this line of work for 5 years.  Reyna is a real fighter and enjoys her business since most of her customers are satisfied with the good quality of the pigs that she sells.  Her husband works as a farmer and they both provide income for their household and support their three children who are still young.

Reyna is requesting this loan to buy pigs, concentrated feed and other feed for her pigs.  Her greatest challenge is extending her home since that is where she keeps her pigs and she doesn't have a lot of space.  This is her fifth loan and she is ready to make all of her repayments on time because she would like to access another loan in the future.  She feels very grateful to the institution for granting her this loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrated feed and other feed for her pigs

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamaraneh II” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Hassan T.. Hassan is age 55. He was born in Kenema city and lives there together with his wife and three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary school. 

Hassan has been a businessman for many years now. He sells used clothes. With this loan, he will buy used clothes at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy used clothes at wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
Organizar muy bien su negocio, ampliarlo y convertirlo en un gran almacén, es el sueño de María Isabel R. D. quien desde hace 10 años vende mercancía en su local, al mismo tiempo le ayuda a su esposo a la elaboración de fritos que distribuyen para diferentes cafeterías lo que les ha permitido tener mejores ingresos para su familia, aunque son largas las joranadas laborales, esta emprendedora lucha día a día para salir adelante. 

María Isabel necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía y aumentar la variedad de productos.
texts.en:
To organize her business well, to expand it and to turn it into a big store is the dream of María Isabel R. D., who has been selling merchandise from her premises for 10 years.  At the same time, she also helps her husband make fried food which they distribute to cafeterias.  This has enabled them to make good income for their family.  Although her workdays are long, this entrepreneur works hard every single day to get ahead.

María Isabel needs a loan to buy merchandise and increase the variety of products she sells.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Deyanira Del Socorro

texts.es: Deyanira, de 45 años reside en el municipio de Corinto, su negocio es una pulpería, tiene cuatro hijos pero solamente 2 están a su cargo. El negocio lo tiene hace dos años, lo administra todos los días pues tiene la responsabilidad de ofrecerles a sus hijos el pan de cada día todos los días. Todos los días abre su local, con en donde la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes productos diarios. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para surtir la tienda, comprando productos de uso domestico, como granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, jugos, refrescos y pan que son  productos muy necesarios en cada hogar y de calidad. Para Deyanira su aspiración es que el negocio sea fuerte y estable en las ventas, que los ingresos mejoren y dar un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Deyanira is 45 years old and lives in the town of Corinto.  Her business is a grocery store that she has owned for two years.  Deyanira has four children but only two of them are in her care.  She runs her business every day since she is responsible for offering her children their daily bread every day.  She opens her store every day and most of her customers come to buy different products every day.

Deyanira is currently requesting a loan to stock her store.  She will buy household essentials such as basic grains, soap, detergents, juice, soft drinks and bread as these are quality products that are essential in every household.  Deyanira's aspirations are for her business to be strong and stable in terms of sales, for her income to improve and for her family to enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soap, detergents, juice, soft drinks and bread which are essential in every household

loans.name: Miriam Gladys

texts.es:
Miriam de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que vino de Manabí hace 6 años. Se inicio con ventas de  bebida. Con el apoyo de su hermana se propuso a tener una asociación de expendedores de bebidas. 

Ahora tiene su puesto de ambulante en el Malecón de Playas. En la cual labora todo el día vendiendo aguas colas jugos etc. Está  casada con Victor García quien labora en ventas de helados. Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas para incrementar sus ventas. Su meta más deseada es tener su propio local para poder darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam is a hard-working woman of 28 who came to Manabí 6 years ago.  She started out selling drinks.  With the support of her sister, she set out to form an association of drinks sellers.

Miriam now sells her products as an itinerant street vendor in Malecón de Playas.  She works every day selling water, Coke, juice, etc.  Miriam is married to Victor García who sells ice cream.  She would like to use her loan to buy drinks in order to increase her sales.  Her most important goal is to own her own premises so that she can provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy juice, Coke and water

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi B. is single. He lives in the town of Tlumach in the Ivano-Frankivsk region. 

Vitalyi runs a service station in downtown Tlumach where he rents a facility for business purposes. His maintenance station offers running gear repairs, tire vulcanization and wheel geometry services. Vitalyi has one hired employee working for him at the station. He started the venture two years ago. His current monthly income amounts to 12,000 UAH. 

Vitalyi is requesting a 20,000 UAH loan to purchase two automobiles to break down for spare parts. He is planning to sell the dismantled spare parts at a good price and thus generate additional income as a result. One of Vitalyi’s dreams is to do a major makeover in his two-room apartment and construct his own service station in the outskirts of his home town close to a local tourist complex.

loans.use: to purchase two automobiles for dismantling

loans.name: Volver A Nacer Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Volver a Nacer” y está conformado  por 21 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros, específicamente bazar paquetería, corte y confección de ropa, apicultura y venta de abarrotes. 
Leonor es la presidenta del banco y se encuentra en la foto de pie en la primera fila, se ubica al medio y viste suéter azul marino. Ella se dedica  a la producción y venta de empanadas, además de la repostería desde hace 12 años. Su local está ubicado en el Centro comercial de Dichato. Sin embargo debido a las replicas del tsunami de Japón, las altas marejadas asolaron nuevamente la costa de Dichato, lo que ha bajado la afluencia de público y clientes de restaurante que solicitaban sus productos al por mayor. A pesar de ésta situación los fines de semana concurre bastante público.
Leonor vive con sus 4 hijos de 18, 16, 12 y 8 años de edad, quienes le ayudan en su negocio, ya sea en la caja o en la cocina para preparar ciertos productos. Además les ofrece trabajo a 4 personas que se encargan de atender a los clientes, como garzonas y las dos personas restantes son maestras de cocina. 
Su anhelo es que se reconstruya Dichato, junto con esto obtener su vivienda propia, ya que a causa del tsunami que asoló esa zona el 27 de febrero del año 2010, Leonor quedó sin nada, por lo que tuvo que volver a reconstruir su vida y negocio. En éste momento vive con sus hijos en una mediagua que le otorgó la Municipalidad de Dichato. Respecto a su negocio Leonor pretende tener su negocio de manera independiente, para obtener mejores ganancias y armar una microempresa familiar en compañía de sus hijos. Sus motivaciones son brindarles a sus hijos un mejor bienestar y poder costear sus estudios. 
Con el préstamo pretende comprar una freidora eléctrica e insumos para su producción de empanadas, entre estos; harina, huevos, aceite, manteca y mariscos. 
Leonor está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, debido a las facilidades de pago, respecto al banco de socias ella se siente muy contenta, ya que entre ellas existe mucho apoyo y solidaridad. Las capacitaciones le han sido de gran utilidad para su negocio, ya que con estos aprendizajes de distribución en los ingresos, lo ha ido internalizado en su negocio. 
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la región del Bíobío, al sur de Chile. Es conocida como uno de los principales puertos del país. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "cielo tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a su puerto, su Base Naval, y un importante barrio industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc.
texts.en:
This community bank is named “Volver a Nacer” and is made up of 21 members from the city of Talcahuano. All of them are involved in different businesses such as a stationary shop, tailoring and making clothing, beekeeping and selling groceries. 
Leonor is the president of the bank and can be found in the photograph in the front row, she is in the middle wearing a blue sweater. Leonor has been making and selling empanadas and pastries for 12 years. Her shop is located in the commercial center of Dichato. However, due to the aftershocks of the tsunami in Japan, high waves devastated the coast of Dichato again, which has lowered the number of visitors and restaurant customers which sought her products wholesale. Despite this situation the weekends attract a lot people.
Leonor lives with her ​​4 children, 18, 16, 12 and 8 years of age, who help her in her business either at the cash register or in the kitchen to cook certain products. She also employs four people to serve the customers as waiters and the two remaining people are chefs.
Her dreams are that Dichato will be rebuilt and to obtain her own home because she was left with nothing after the tsunami that struck the area on February 27, 2010 and had to rebuild her life and her business. Currently, she is living with her children in a shack the city of Dichato provided for her. Regarding her business, Leonor intends to have her business independently, to obtain higher profits and build a microenterprise with her children. Her motivations are to provide her children with a better life and to fund their studies.
With this loan she intends to buy an electric fryer and supplies to make empanadas such as flour, eggs, oil, lard and seafood. 
Leonor is very grateful for the loan granted by field partner Fondo Esperanza because of the ease in making payments. She is very happy with the community bank because their is a lot of support and solidarity among its members. The trainings have been very useful for her business. She has internalized the lessons in income distribution in her business. 
Talcahuano is a municipality and port city in the Bíobío region in southern Chile. It is known as one of the main ports in the country. Its name in Mapudungun (the Mapuche language) means "thundering sky. " It has a very attractive natural landscape due to the combination of rivers, sea, fertile plains and mountain meadows with a beautiful vegetation. Its economy revolves around its port, naval base and an important industrial district with steel companies, oil refining, petrochemical, cement, gas, etc.

loans.use: to purchase an electric fryer, flour, eggs, oil, lard and seafood.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto tiene 45 años, es un joven trabajador que desde muy pequeño empezó a ganarse la vida, antes de tener este negocio trabajaba como auxiliar de enfermería, pero pensando en mejorar su nivel de económico viajo a estados unidos en busca de sus sueños, pero él fue deportado hacia Guatemala en donde saco un curso de belleza y posteriormente regreso a Nicaragua en donde renovó sus conocimientos sobre belleza y así es como obtiene esta actividad. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días. Ofrece todo tipo de servicio, cortes, cambios en general, es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de tijeras, cepillos, pastas, tintes, agua oxigenada entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en: Jorge Alberto is 45 years old, he is a worker who began to earn his living from a young age. Before having this business he used to work as a nursing assistant, but he decided to improve his financial well being and travelled to the United States in search of his dreams, but he was deported to Guatemala where he took a beauty course and subsequently returned to Nicaragua where he renewed his knowledge about beauty and this is how he got into this business. Currently he works daily from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening. He offers all types of service, haircuts, changes in general. He is requesting this loan for the purpose of buying scissors, brushes, pastes, dyes, and peroxide among other necessary products.

loans.use: to buy scissors, brushes, pastes, dyes, and peroxide.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir D. is married with two grown daughters and a teenage one. 

He is a farming entrepreneur from the town of Blagoveschenka. Vladimir grows vegetables in greenhouses for further sale in different regions of Ukraine. He owns two land lots, eight big greenhouses and two separate ones for seedlings. Vladimir has been a farmer for 28 years. He has already invested over 50,000 UAH in the enterprise. 

Vladimir is seeking a 12,000 UAH loan to purchase seeds, plastic film and fertilizers for this farming season and to reconstruct one of his greenhouses.

Vladimir is looking into the future with much optimism. The farming business has huge potential in the region and Vladimir is willing and ready to invest more finances and efforts in its further development.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic film and fertilizers

loans.name: Ngoyelia Women Association Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses and make more sales and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school and feeding and clothing them. 

Fatmata M. is the leader of this group. Fatmata M. was born in Kenema. She is 30 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Fatmata M. sells rice, pepper, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying rice, pepper, margi, etc., in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, margi, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and livestock for business expansion

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana P. is divorced with an 8-year-old daughter. She lives in Ivano-Frankivsk.

Tetyana and her mother own a small bakery and eight vending locations where their baked goods are sold. Tetyana’s venture boasts reasonable prices and favorable locations for her kiosks in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. Tetyana has been working in this sphere of business for nine years. Currently, she receives 10,000 UAH of income every month. Tetyana and her mother have 15 hired employees.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase flour for the bakery. She is also planning to use a portion of borrowed funds to pay the rent for her vending facilities. Tetyana is hoping to continue developing her business in the future ensuring decent living conditions for her growing daughter.

loans.use: to purchase flour for her bakery

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionisio, de 63 años, es un hombre noble y responsable. Vive junto a su esposa María, de 54 años  y sus 5 hijos mayores, en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la albañilería, y él mismo construyó su casa, y el local con sus respetivos detalles para un spa. Desde entonces su hijo y su esposa se dedican a este negocio, hace más de 10 años, y les va muy bien. Por ello Dionisio, se siente orgulloso y contento por brindar todas las comodidades a su familia, por lo que ahora  ve la rentabilidad del negocio de su familia. Por ello, ahora se ha propuesto acondicionar un espacio apropiado para preparar jugos y mates,  para que se deleiten sus clientes mientras esperan su turno.  Por ello, este emprendedor hombre se ha propuesto  comprar cemento y cerámicas, para que prosiga su trabajo y, de ese modo amplíe su negocio como lo ha planeado. Posteriormente con estas ganancias más tu ayuda, anhela proseguir construyendo el tercer piso de su casa, para después alquilarlos. Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, para seguir contando con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita,  comprará mayólicas, cemento y renovar los espejos de su spa.
texts.en: Dionicio, who is 63 years old, is a dignified and responsible man. He lives with his wife, Maria, who is 54, and their 5 adult children, in their own house. He has worked all his life as bricklayer, and he himself built their house, including a section with all the appropriate details for a spa. Since then, for more than 10 years, his son and his wife have worked at this business, and it has gone very well for them. Dionicio is very proud of this, and he is happy to offer all the comforts to his family, because he now sees the profitability of the family business. Because of this, he now proposes to air-condition an appropriate space to prepare juices and mates, to please their customers while they wait their turns. To do this, this enterprising man has proposed buying cement and tiles, so that he can pursue his work and in this way expand his business as he has planned. Later, with these additional earnings to help him, he wants to continue constructing the third floor of his house, so that he can rent it out. This is his 10th loan with MFP, and he promises to make all his payments on time, so that he can continue to have help in the future. With the loan that he is applying for, he will buy tiles and cement and renovate the mirrors in his spa.

loans.use: Buy cement, tiles, and renovate the mirrors in his beauty salon.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan B. is single. He is a private entrepreneur from Beregovo. He sells men’s clothing in a local mall called Image.  Stepan is an experienced vendor with good taste in quality clothing. He has been in this business for 14 years. Stepan has invested about 60,000 Grivnyas in inventory.  

Stepan is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to add seasonal merchandise to his stock. He is planning to buy jackets, jumpers, and sportswear for spring. Stepan is a devoted businessman who is seeking to expand his business, thereby bringing him stable profits.

loans.use: To purchase jackets, jumpers, and sportswear

loans.name: Gbatima Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Gbatima II” group. They are small businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mohamed K.. Mohamed is 32; he was born in Tongo, a town in eastern Sierra Leone.  Currently, he is residing and doing business in Kenema, together with his wife and two children. 

Mohamed sells used clothes and has been running this business for five years now. With his share of this loan, he will expand his business by buying a bale of used clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business

loans.name: Hector Hernán

texts.es:
Desde las 3:00 de la mañana Hector Hernán T. M. y su grupo familiar están en pie para iniciar con la elaboración de la mazamorra, producto típico de Antioquia-Colombia, que se convirtió en la fuente de sustento para esta familia. 

Después de la dispendiosa elaboración de la mazamorra, Héctor sale a ofrecer el producto por las calles de Puerto Berrío donde es conocido por su buena sazón. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones en el lugar de producción.
texts.en: From 3:00 in the morning Hector Hernán T. M. and his family group are up to begin making mazamorra, a traditional product in Antioquia-Colombia. It has become the source of income for this family.  After the laborious production of the mazamorra, Héctor goes out to offer the product in the streets of Puerto Berrío, where he is known for being a good cook. At present, he needs a loan to refurbish the production area.

loans.use: to refurbish a processing area

loans.name: Verida Antonia

texts.es:
Verida de 62 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que desde pequeña le gustaba tener una tienda por medio de su mama. Después de terminar el Colegio abrió una pequeña tienda.

El trabajo de ella es diario debido al requerimiento de los productos de primera necesidad por partes de vecinos y clientes. Su esposo tiene un puesto de ventas de frutas en el mercado. Con el préstamo quiere incrementar sus ventas de víveres arroz, azúcar, aceites, atunes  y mejorar el aspecto del local. Y en un futuro tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Verida, who is 62 years old, is a hard-working woman who, ever since she was a little girl, wanted to have a store because of her mother. After finishing school, she opened a little store.

Her work is daily, thanks to her neighbors' and customers' needs for basic products. He husband has a stall in the market where he sells fruit. With the loan, she wants to increase her sales of grocery items such as rice, sugar, oils, and olives and improve the appearance of the store. In the future she wants to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and olives.

loans.name: Rosa Araceli

texts.es: Rosa Araceli tiene 34 años tiene un hijo es conviviente hace mas de 5 años viven en casa familiar, se dedica a la bodega hace mas de 3 años su cònyuge es preventista de la empresa KARINTO cuenta con buenas referencias personales y experiencia crediticia,solicita dicho crèdito para la compra de un activo fijo se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en: Rosa Araceli is 34 years old and has one son. She has been common-law married for over five years and lives in a house with her family. She has been running a bodega [small grocery store] for more than three years. Her partner is a pre-sales agent for the Karinto snack company. Rosa Araceli has good personal references and borrowing experience. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a fixed asset. She presents herself as someone who has the capacity and above all the willingness to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a fixed asset for her small grocery store

loans.name: María Sorany

texts.es:
Desde pequeña María Sorany R. G. aprendió el oficio de la confección, aunque su esposo trabaja su salario no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos del hogar, fue entonces cuando con el apoyo de una amiga decidió crear su propio negocio de confección a terceros y su propia línea con el fin de aportar para cubrir los gastos del hogar . 

Actualmente Maria Sorany necesita de un préstamo para comprar materia prima e insumos con el fin de sacar una nueva producción e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Sorany R. G. learned the sewing profession when she was young. Although her husband works, his salary was not enough to cover their household expenses. That was when, with the support of a friend, she decided to start her own sewing business. She sews for third parties and has her own line. Her goal is to contribute to covering the household expenses.

María Sorany currently needs a loan to buy materials in order to start a new production and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to refurbish a motorcycle taxi and sell clothes.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Francisco Javier  C. le esta haciendo falta terminar un cuarto el cual será para su hija. 
Don Francisco esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que esta realizando la mejora. Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para terminar al recamara de su niña. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que tiene de su trabajo como vendedor.
Desea mejor la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Francisco Javier C. needs to finish building a room in his home that will be for his daughter.  He is requesting a loan to buy the materials he needs and to pay the person who is carrying out the improvement as, right now, he doesn't have the money he needs to finish his daughter's bedroom.  He plans to repay his loan with part of the income that he earns in his job as a salesman.  He would like to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to finish building a room

loans.name: Maria Celestina

texts.es:
Doña Maria Celestina C. M., señora casada, tiene 35 años de edad, ha cursado la educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales estudian, se dedica a la artesanía (elaboración de cintas típicas), tiene ya 18 años de realizar este trabajo, aprendió el oficio con un familiar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo como capital, para comprar hilo materia prima del trabajo que realiza, espera que por medio del prestamo mejorar su negocio y su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Celestina C. M. is a 35 year-old married lady who completed her elementary school education.  She has two children who are in school.  Maria is in the handicraft business (she makes traditional belts).  She has been in this line of work for 18 years, having learned the trade from a family member.  She has the support of her husband who is a construction worker. 

Maria is requesting a loan to use as capital to buy yarn which is raw material for the work that she carries out.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve her business and her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy yarn for weaving traditional belts

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es: Yovana de 26 años, natural de la comunidad la Libertad anexo del distrito de Quimbiri; esta casada con Alfredo de 30 años de edad y tienen 02 hijas Rosalía de 09 y  Gressy de 07 meses de nacida y juntos viven en su propio lote a medio construir situado en el distrito de Quimbiri. Yovana, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo trata de sobresalir ante las adversidades del destino. Yovana es comerciante tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en el mercado del distrito de Quimbiri. La bodega de Yovana es la primera en abrirse, apertura las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la certeza de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así estar al tanto de las cosas que suceden en su ámbito circular, lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa invertir sus ganancias en verduras y depender de dos ingresos a la vez  por lo cual ella se esmera cada día por lograr ese propósito. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, siente que el crédito le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo, y a su vez agradece a la Institución  por concederle el préstamo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, adquirirá mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yovana is 26 years old and from La Libertad community, a small village in Quimbiri district.  She is married to 30 year-old Alfredo and they have two daughters, 9 year-old Rosalía and 7 month-old Gressy.  They live together on their own half-built lot which is located in Quimbiri district.

Yovana is a very industrious woman who works hard and does her best to excel even when faced with the adversities that fate sometimes provides.  Yovana is a saleswoman who has a grocery store in Quimbiri district market.  Yovana's store is the first to open each day.  She opens her business at 6.00am and is ready to receive her first customers who know that she sells a good variety of merchandise in her store and so do not hesitate to buy from her.  They know that they will find the products they need.  What Yovana most likes about her work is chatting to her customers as, in this way, she is always up to date with what is going on around her.  She has been in this business for 4 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stand up almost all day long.

Yovana will use the loan she has requested to buy more food products for her business so that she can stock her store with merchandise.  Over time, she plans to invest her profits in buying vegetables.  In this way, she will have two incomes.  She does her best every day to make sure she achieves this goal.

This is Yovana's third loan from MFP.  She feels that this loan will really help her to make progress in her business and she is grateful to the institution for granting her the loan.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James J. owns Ideal Maintenance and Janitorial.  James worked as a school custodian for seventeen years before starting Ideal Maintenance and Janitorial, which he considers to be an ongoing application of all the trades he has learned over his career.  He started Ideal Maintenance and Janitorial to better support himself and his family, with the idea that owning his own business could make him more financially independent. 

Aside from cleaning businesses and residences, James does a wide variety of “odd jobs.”  When it comes to repairs, James says he can do pretty much anything people ask.  For example, he has a client who bought a house and asked him to inspect it to make sure that everything in it is functional.  

In addition to running his business, James currently works as a custodian at Tulane hospital.  He says that most of his clients come from relationships he builds through his work at the hospital, or from clients’ referrals.  James is using this loan to advertise his business and buy floor-cleaning equipment.  He wants to advertise on the radio, as well as make business cards he can give to potential customers.  

James loves owning his own business because he says it keeps him motivated.  Someday, he wants to grow Ideal Maintenance and Janitorial to the point that he can run it full-time.  He also wants to open an office to have a physical location for his business, instead of running it from home.  

Despite his busy schedule, James tries to help others when he can.  He helps the physically disabled by taking them to the store or picking up their medicine.  His advice for business owners is to make time for others, even when there isn’t a profit.

loans.use: to advertise his business and buy floor-cleaning equipment.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos de 39 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde muy joven aprendió a confeccionar ropa. Poco a poco fue incursionando en la sastrería hasta llega a tener su taller. 

Inicio su negocio con una máquina de coser y aprendió poco a poco la costura mediante de pedidos.  Pero para generar más ingresos él comenzó a trabajar en una compañía de seguro hasta ahora  ya que tiene tres hijos. Pero en los horarios que no trabaja en la compañía se dedica a la confección de ropa.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar telas, hilos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 39 years old. He is a hardworking man who learned how to make clothes when he was very young. Little by little, he worked in tailoring until he was able to have his own shop. 

He started his business with a sewing machine and learned sewing little by little through the orders. In order to make more income, he started to work with an insurance company, where he still works, since he has three children. But when he's not working at the company, he makes clothes. He has a lot of dreams for his business and that it why he wants the loan, to buy fabric and thread.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Jonatan Mardoqueo Miguel

texts.es: Jonatan Mardoqueo Miguel T. C., es casado, tiene 21 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica la albañileria, tiene 6 años ya de experiencia de reaizar este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la artesanía, tejido de tipicos. Solicita un crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda, y tambien para compra de hilo para artesanía, ya que la esposa de este socio se dedica a la artesanía en este caso a la tejeduría. Espera terminar de construir su vivienda con el préstamo que esta solicitando a ASDIR.
texts.en:
Jonatan Mardoqueo Miguel T. C., 21, is married and has one child.  He’s a Bricklayer and has six years experience in this line of work.  His wife helps him; she’s an artisan making typical woven crafts.

He’s asking for a loan to finish building his house and also to buy thread for the crafts since this member’s wife is an artisan who does weavings.  He hopes to finish building the house with the loan he’s asking from ASDIR.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Campanita De Oro Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Campanita D. oro", el grupo esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. el Rincon D. los Pirules, San felipe del progreso, L. comunidad es D. escasos recursos, es algo alejada del municipio y por lo tanto hay pocos servicios publicos, son caminos empedarados y caminos con mucha tierra suelta, L. comunidad en general se dedica a L. agricultura y ganaderia, en esta comunidad no hay señal y el transporte es un poco limitado, ya se cuenta con una preparatoria para que los jovenes puedan preparase y no les cueste estar viajando hasta el centro del municipio, el grupo lo integran 8 personas, son 8 mujeres que tienen su actividad pero que nesecitan una ayuda para mejorar un poco, desidieron llamarse así "campanita D. oro" porque lo consideran D. buena suerte para sus negocios y le vaya bien al grupo en general. Los nombres D. las integrantes son los siguientes:
1.-Florenacia D. L. C. G., tiene 48 años
2.-Claudia E. G., tiene 23 años
3.-Ma Benita Catarina B., 45 años
4.-Delfina M. F., 32 años D. edad
5.-Gregoria S. C., 56 años D. edad
6.-Heriberta M. E., 32 años
7.-Lucia S. A., 25 años D. edad
8.-Juana A. T., 58 años D. edad
L. representante del grupo se llama Heriberta, elL. es vecina D. todos los integrantes y los conoce desD. hace ya varios años y se llevan muy bien, elL. tiene 4 hijos y los cuatro estudian, es casada y cumplio 10 años, vive en casa propia con su esposo, su esposo trabaja como albañil y en una carpinteria, doña Heriberta tiene un local pequeño en su casa y venD. refrescos, aguas y tambien sabritas, pero nesecita aun mas cosas para que le vaya un poco mejor, nesecita una inversion y comprar otras cosas que le hacen falta a su tienda como por ejemplo; el huevo y jamon que son productos que se venden bien por estar alejados D. L. comunidad mucha gente lo busca, tambien L. salchicha y L. longaniza como tambien algo D. cremeria, en fin son muchas cosas que quiere vender pero hace falta el dinero para poder vender todo eso. Unas D. las metas son que el negocio cresca y poder realizar L. idea D. poder poner una tienda granD. en L. comunidad para mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. mi familia.
texts.en:
This group is named "Campanita D. Oro" [Little Gold Bell]. The group is located in the community of El Rincon D. los Pirules, San Felipe del Progreso. The community is low income, and a little far from town. Because of this, there are few public services, the roads have gravel on them or have a lot of loose earth. In general, the commuity works in farming and cattle. There is no traffic light in the community and transportation is very limited. It does have a high school so that the youth can be educated and not have to spend money travelling to the downtown. The group is maD. up of 8 people. They are 8 women who have their activities, but who need some help to improve a little. They decided to call themselves "Campanita D. Oro" because they think that it brings good luck to their businesses and is good for the group in general. The names of the group members are the following: 

1.-Florenacia D. L. C. G.,  48 years old.  
2.-Claudia E. G., 23 years old.
3.-Ma Benita Catarina B., 45 years old.
4.-Delfina M. F., 32 years old. 
5.-Gregoria S. C., 56 years old. 
6.-Heriberta M. E., 32 years old.
7.-Lucia S. A., 25 years old. 
8.-Juana A. T., 58 years old. 

The group representative is named Heriberta. She is a neighbor of all of the members and she has known them for several years, and she gets along well with them. She has 4 children and they all go to school. She has been married for 10 years. She lives in her own house with her husband, who works as a bricklayer and carpenter. Heriberta has a small locale in her house where she sells beverages, water and chips. She needs more things so that things can improve for her a little. She needs an investment to buy other things as well that her store needs, such as: eggs and ham, which sell well, because they are far from town and a lot of people need them. Also, sausages and chorizo as well as dairy products. In short, she needs a lot of things that she wants to sell but she lacks the money to sell all of it. One of her goals is for the business to grow and little by little to have a large store in the community, in order to improve the quality of life in her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Fenix Group

texts.es:
La señora Erika Estrella M. C., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chipas México, vive en unión libre con el señor Damián Gómez E. y con quien procreo dos hijos: José Antonio de  cinco años y Erik Damián  de dos años.

     Ella es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo en fundación y es para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de  antojitos  en donde lleva nueve años y así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos.

     Para dedicarse a esta actividad la animaron sus cuñadas, para que así tenga ingresos y se apoye con algunos gastos que se generan en su hogar y así cubrirlas sin ningún detalle.

    Con la ganancia que va obteniendo  lo invierte en la misma actividad y así seguir trabajando como ella le gusta realizar su venta de antojitos.

    Lo que desea es que con este oficio que tiene aunque humildemente logre tener ahorros para comprar materiales y construir su casa más grande.

     Las personas que integran en el grupo son las siguientes: 

Erika Estrella M. C.: ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de chorizos y tostadas.
Olga Lidia J. E.: Compra de productos por catálogo como ropa de mujer, lencería, sabanas, cholcas, etc.
Elaine H. H.: Compra y venta de cosméticos por catálogo de la marca BLONDY.
Fany J. E.: Compra y venta de cosméticos por catálogo de la marca JAFRA
texts.en:
Erika Estrella M. C. lives in Tecpatan, Chiapas, Mexico.  She is the common-law wife of Damián Gómez E., and they have two children:  José Antonio (5 years old), and Erik Damián (2 years old).

This is the first time she has requested a loan from the foundation, and it will be used to buy ingredients to prepare appetizers.  She has been doing this for nine years, and thus supports her spouse with the income.

Her sisters-in-law encouraged her to take up this work, to have income and provide support for some of the household’s expenses, to cover them effectively.

She will use the earnings derived for the same business, and continue to work, for she likes selling appetizers.

Her wish is to use this modest business to have savings sufficient to buy materials and expand her house.

Members of the group are:

Erika Estrella M. C.:  she will use the loan to purchase ingredients to prepare sausages and toasted breads.
Olga Lidia Juárez E.:  to buy items by catalogue, such as women’s clothing, linens, sheets, bedspreads, etc.
Elaine H. Hernández:  to buy cosmetics through the Blondy catalogue and sell them.
Fany Juárez E.:  to buy cosmetics through the Jafra catalogue and sell them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients used to prepare sausages and toasted breads

loans.name: Zacarias Mizael

texts.es:
Zacarías de 35 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Comenzó la tienda porque su papa siempre le enseño hacer panes y vender víveres, poco a poco con la experiencia de su padre el decidió tener el mismo negocio. 

Ahora el tiene una pequeña tienda surtida con una panadería. Realiza tortas, bocaditos y vende víveres. Trabaja desde las 05h00am haciendo panes, bocaditos etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su tienda-panadería. Por eso quiere el préstamo para tener más ingresos y comprar vitrinas para su local. En el futuro quiere mejorar su negocio y ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Zacarías is 35 years old.  He is a hard-working man who has a small store in the front of his home.  He set up his store because his dad taught him how to make bread and sell food products.  Gradually, with his father's exeperience, he decided to set up in this business.

Now Zacarías has a small store and bakery.  He makes cakes and snacks and sells food products.  He works from 5.00am making his bread, snacks, etc.

Zacarías has many aspirations for his store-bakery.  He would like this loan so that he can make more income and buy display cabinets for his premises.  In the future, he would like to improve his business and extend his house.

loans.use: to buy display cabinets

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana forma parte del Banco comunal “Compartiendo Esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna. Ella se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes, bebidas, cecinas, lácteos, helados, entre otros. En un kiosco ubicado al lado de su departamento. Rubro que realiza desde hace 8 años, en horario continuado de las 10:00 a las 23:30 horas.
Ella compra parte de su mercadería en supermercados mayoristas y el resto que necesita lo solicita a pedido a los proveedores de los productos.
Eliana trabaja sola en este negocio, sin embargo sus hijos le ayudan en el traslado de mercadería y arreglos de construcción en su kiosco. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, para abastecer su negocio.
Su motivación de continuar con éste, es para obtener mejores ingresos y de esta manera tener una vida más confortable. 
Eliana está muy agradecida y contenta de participar de Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le ayudará a invertir en su negocio. Además participa de las reuniones en las cuales comparte y aprende.
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Eliana belongs to the “Sharing the Effort” cooperative bank, located in the city of La Cisterna.  She dedicates herself to selling groceries, beverages, cold cuts, dairy products, ice creams and other items from a kiosk next to her apartment.  She has been doing this activity for more than 8 years, from 10:00 am until 11:30 pm.  She buys some of her merchandise at the wholesale markets, and orders the rest of what she needs from the providers of those products.  She works alone, however her children help her with transporting of goods and making repairs to her kiosk.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise to supply her business.

Her main motivation to continue is her desire to obtain better income and, in this manner, manage to have a more comfortable life.  Eliana is very thankful and grateful to participate in Fondo Esperanza, since the loan will help her invest in her business.  In addition, she participates in the meetings in which she shares from her experiences and learns.  

La Cisterna is a community located in the central-south sector of the Metropolitana region.  It’s a primarily residential and commercial community.  Initially, it was a rural area with large parcels of land.  However, because of the population’s growth and the arrival of basic services, it has evolved into a 100% urban area.

loans.use: mercadería, para abastecer su negocio

loans.name: José Abad

texts.es:
José Abad D. vive en la ciudad de Medellín. Es un hombre desplazado del municipio de San Carlos, Departamento de Antioquia que debido a la presencia de grupos guerrilleros y paramilitares, tuvo que abandonar su finca y su tierra por las amenazas. Gracias a la ayuda de un amigo empezó a vender artículos en la calle como correas, billeteras y gorras. 

Actualmente depende económicamente de este negocio y trabaja de 9 am a 7pm, sin embargo en la época de invierno, debe cerrar su negocio por la lluvia para proteger su mercancía. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercancía y poder obtener con estas ventas los recursos necesarios para poder tener un local donde estén más seguros sus productos.
texts.en:
José Abad D. lives in the city of Medellín.  He is a man displaced from the San Carlos municipality in the department of Antioquia, given the presence of guerrilla groups and the paramilitary.  He had to abandon his farm and his lands due to these threats to his safety.

Thanks to the help of a friend, he started to sell merchandise such as belts, billfolds and hats, on the street.  He currently depends on this business financially, and works from 9 am until 7 pm.  However, during winter, he must close his business because of the rain in order to protect his goods.

He wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise and, through his sales, obtain the necessary resources to open his own locale where his merchandise can be secure.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Yasna

texts.es:
Yasna forma parte del banco comunal “Arco Iris” perteneciente a la ciudad de Osorno.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo artículos para regalos en una galería ubicada en el centro de Osorno. Yasna se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 3 años. Yasna tiene muchos clientes debido a la ubicación de su local.
Con éste préstamo pretende comprar peluches, papeles de regalo y accesorios para el cabello, especialmente para la temporada del día de la madre que es una de las fechas en las cuales existe más demanda de compra. 
Su  mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, en una distribuidora.
Yasna vive junto a sus dos hijas de 18 y 11 años de edad. Su hija mayor es quien le ayuda administrar su negocio.
El sueño de Yasna es que sus hijas terminen estudios universitarios y sean profesionales. Es por esto, su motivación de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
Sus metas a nivel comercial, es poder abastecer su negocio con mercadería y ampliar su local, ya que de esta manera aumentarían sus ingresos. 

Para Yasna los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que con éstos podrá invertir. También se encuentra muy contenta y a gusto con su grupo. Ya que le ha permitido crear lazos de amistad. 
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
Yasna belongs to the “Rainbow” cooperative bank, located in the city of Osorno.  She dedicates herself to commerce, selling articles for gifts from a gallery located in the center of Osorno.  She has been in this business for 3 years, and has many customers because of her store’s location.  She wants to use this loan to buy stuffed animals, gift wrapping paper and hair accessories, all of which are especially important as Mother’s Day approaches.  This is one of the times of year when her merchandise is in highest demand.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, at a distributor’s.  

Yasna lives with her two daughters, ages 18 and 11.  Her older daughter helps her run the business.  Yasna’s dreams are for her children to finish their university educations and become professionals.  This is the main reason she would like to continue investing in her enterprise.  Her goals on a business level are to be able to supply and expand her store, which will allow her to augment her income.  The loans via Fondo Esperanza have greatly helped Yasna’s business, as they have allowed her to invest in it.  She also finds herself very happy with her group, and has made many friendships this way.  

Osorno is located in the southern part of Chile, in the Los Lagos region.  It is an important agricultural area, which identifies itself as “The Homeland of Milk and Land of Meat” of Chile.  Within the agricultural activities in the region, what stands out are the cultivation of corn and oats, the raising of livestock for meat and dairy products processing, in addition to the fabrication of farming equipment.  Osorno is known for having the only covered soccer stadium in Chile, the "Rubén Marcos” municipal stadium.

loans.use: to purchase stuffed animals, gift wrapping paper, and hair accessories.

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es: Victoria es integrante D. la Alcancía comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” en donD. 07 personas emprendedoras D. su propio destino se reúnen desD.  hace 6 años para conseguir un capital D. trabajo D. acuerdo a sus economías y estilo D. vida.  Victoria a sus 63 años D. edad es casada y trabaja hace 25 años vendiendo golosinas en su propia carretilla frente a un centro educativo D. su comunidad, en donD. venD. diversas golosinas y bebidas. Junto a su esposo que tiene una pequeña carpintería en su vivienda, victoria es conocida como Vicky solicito este nuevo préstamo para invertir en su carretilla y surtirla con variedad D. golosinas para reciente temporada D. escolar pues recientemente se iniciaron las clases D. manera regular. Su seño es tener un negocio formal e implementar su pequeño negocio D. venta D. golosinas y así ayudar a sus hijos. Vicky participa activamente en su alcancía comunal y esta agradecida D. tener este nuevo capital  y le entusiasma  el poder ahorrar para su futuro. Nuestra Alcom Uniendo fuerzas posa en compañía D. sus pequeños hijos, no nos acompaño la socia Mariluz H. por la distancia D. su centro D. labores.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the “Joining Forces” cooperative bank, where 7 individuals in charge of their own destiny have met for the past 6 years to obtain working capital befitting their financial situations and lifestyles.  Victoria, 63 years of age, is married and, for the past 25 years, has manned a stand in front of a school in her community where she sells snacks and beverages.

Together with her husband, who runs a small carpentry workshop in their house, Victoria (known as Vicky), requests a new loan to invest further into her business.  The funds will allow her to stock her stand with a variety of snacks for the new school year, as classes just started again on a regular basis.

Her dream is to have an established business so she can help her children.  Vicky is an active participant in her cooperative bank, and is thankful for this opportunity to access new working capital.  She is enthusiastic about being able to save for her future.

Our “Joining Forces” cooperative bank members pose along with their small children, except for Mariluz H., due to the distant area where her work is located.

loans.use: to purchase snacks for her business.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 4 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group, El Sol Sale Para Todos 4 & 6. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge right now is improving her business. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to do business by selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other items.

Lucia is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for more than four years, starting her business with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying all kind of products, from cosmetics to clothing. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She wants to have a successful business.

This Esperanza associate began working with this group because she was interested in investing in her business and she needed capital to improve her inventory. Lucia's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and a lack of electricity.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, jewelry and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Las Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las Carmelitas y se ubica en la localidad de Julián Grajales, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México.

    La señora Deonila Gutiérrez M., es viuda y tuvo cuatro hijos tres varones y una mujer, quienes tres ya están casados y Rosa Aurelia de diesi siete años  quien a  un está a su responsabilidad.

    Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes, como son: masa, carne, chile ancho, hoja de guineo, pasas, entre otros, para la elaboración de tamales, en donde lleva once años de experiencia y comenta que le va bien  ya que con ellos a estado sacando adelante a su familia.

     Para poner esta actividad lo decidió sola ya que para sacar adelante a sus hijos tenía que emprender un trabajo de lo que le diera resultado y obtuviera un buen ingreso para sostenerse en la vida y gracias adiós lo está logrando.

     Con la ganancia que va obteniendo se apoya para apoyar a su hija que está estudiando y quiere que tenga lo más necesario  para su educación, de eso mismo obtiene para comprar más ingredientes y así poder seguir trabajando.
 
     Su más  grande deseo es que logre salir adelante para darle lo mejor  a su hija y  así sin ningún pretexto deje de echarle ganas en seguir estudiando.

     En el grupo se integro por una invitación que le hizo la señora María del Carmen  quien es su vecina a que solicitaran un préstamo para apoyarse y trabajar alguna actividad en la que se apoyaran.

     Las integrantes del grupo son tres y son las siguientes:

     Deonila Gutiérrez M.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales y  luego venderlo en la misma comunidad.

     Carmela Hernández Sánchez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de puertas, ventanas, entre otros para posteriormente venderlo.

      María del Carmen N. G.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de Panes.
texts.en:
The group is called “Las Carmelitas”, and they are located in the locality of Julián Grajales in Chiapas, México.  Deonila Gutiérrez M. is a widow and has four children, three boys and a girl, of whom three are now married.  Her youngest, Rosa Aurelia, is seventeen years old and still dependent on her.  She will invest the loan into the purchase of ingredients such as: dough, meat, chilies, banana leaves, raisins, and other items for making tamales.  She has eleven years of experience in this business, and tells us that things are going well as it allows her to help her family get ahead.

She made the decision to start this business on her own since, in order to support her children, she had to undertake a type of work that would produce results and generate income. 

With the earnings, she helps her daughter continue her education and reinvests a portion back into the business, purchasing ingredients so she can keep working.  Her greatest wish is to get ahead so she can offer her daughter a higher standard of living, and so there are no excuses for her to quit school.

She joined the group through an invitation from María del Carmen, a neighbor, who suggested they seek support for their businesses.  The three members of the group are as follows:  

Deonila Gutiérrez M.: will invest her funds into the purchase of ingredients for making tamales, to later sell within her own community.

Carmela Hernández Sánchez: will invest her funds into materials for making doors, windows, and other items, to later sell.

María del Carmen N. G.: will invest her funds into ingredients for making bread.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tamales to sell within her own community.

loans.name: Silvia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Silvia de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su tienda. Empezó a trabaja en el comedor de su mama y adquirió experiencia para administrar un negocio. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las20h00pm en su pequeña tienda de víveres. Pero quiere continuar con su tienda por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, snack, galletas etc. En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y surtir con mercadería su tienda.
texts.en:
Silvia, 32, is a hard-working woman with a lot of aspirations for her store.  She started working in her mother's cafeteria and got experience running a business.

At present she works from 8 in the morning until 8 at night in her little grocery store.  But she'd like to keep her business going, so she wants use her loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, cookies, etc.  In the future she wants to stick with her business and stock up the store.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: Corazón D. Jesús es el nombre que representa L. creencia D. esta nueva Alcancía Comunal D. el programa prosperidad -  Edaprospo y gracias al fomento D. nuestras socias D. un grupo D. Huaripachi,  se formo con 09 integrantes en su mayoría mujeres que se dedican al comercio y producción con sus propias manos. Juana rosa  es una D. ellas y es designada como presidenta D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”. Se dedica a comercializar colchas y prendas D. vestir para niños, Juana rosa viene trabajando así casi 5 años, pues nos manifiesta que el clima frio D. L. zona le favorece y vio en este negocio alternativas D. ingresos adicionales por que junto a su conviviente comparten los gastos en su casa, a sus 54 años D. edad Juana Rosa  ayuda  a una D. sus nietas a seguir capacitándose en L. carrera técnica D. contabilidad, pues su lucha constante es conseguir que sus hijos y nietos sean personas D. bien y trabajadores. Podemos ver L. fotografía en donD.  están reunidos incluso alguno D. sus hijos les acompañan, en L. zona L. electricidad es D. baja potencia por lo alejado.
texts.en:
‘Corazon D. Jesus’ [Jesus’ Heart] is the name that represents the beliefs of the communal group from Edaprospo prosperity program. The group was formed thanks to the support of the nine members from Huaripachi, mostly women, who have small businesses and make things by hand.

Juana Rosa is one of the group members and is the president. She sells blankets and children’s clothes. She has been doing it for five years because, she says, the cold climate aids this kind of business and it provides additional income to help her common-law partner with the family expenses.

At 54, Juana Rosa supports one of her grand-daughters so that she may complete her technical training as an accountant. Her constant struggle is to make sure that her children and grandchildren become good people and hard workers. We can see the photo where the group and part of her family are together. The electricity is not very strong in their area because it is remote.

loans.use: to buy blankets and children's clothes

loans.name: Aguilas De Corazon Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”ÁGUILAS DE CORAZÓN”, está iniciando su octavo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de nueve  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Mery. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos la carpintería, venta de lana, venta de celulares, venta de chamarras, venta de comida, comercio, venta de salchipapas, comercio de zapatos, venta de ropa.

La presidenta, señora Mery es una mujer joven, tiene 26 años y esta esperando un bebe. Este es su cuarto año que trabaja con asociaciones comunales,  desarrollando un negocio sola. 

En la actualidad comercializa celulares, los que compra de ocasión, nos cuenta que con el crédito que sacará pretende comprar más mercadería que venderá en la feria de la 16 de julio de forma ambulante, pues ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo.

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora Mery responde  el crédito.
texts.en:
The ”Águilas de Corazón" [Eagles With Heart] Community Lending Association is starting its eight loan cycle in the Los Andes Regional Office.  There are nine members of the association, and Mery is the president of the board of directors.

The women are in different businesses, including woodworking, and sales of wood, cell phones, jackets, meals, salchipapas [sausage and potatoes], shoes, and clothing.

Mery, the president, is a young woman of 26, who is expecting a baby.  This is her fourth year working with community lending associations and she's building her business on her own.  

Currently Mery is a cell phone vendor; she buys the phones second hand.  She tells us she plans to use her loan to buy more merchandise to sell at the 16 de Julio Market from her mobile cart, since she doesn't have a permanent stand.

When we asked Mery what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana forma parte del banco comunal “Arco Iris” perteneciente a la ciudad de Osorno.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, Eliana atiende un minimarket desde hace 2 años, su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, por lo que compra al por mayor, resultando más conveniente económicamente.  Su horario laboral es de 9ºº de la mañana a 10ºº de la noche, de lunes a sábado. 
Con éste préstamo pretende comprar artículos escolares y surtido de carnes y verduras.
Eliana vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas de 28, 22 y 13 años. La hija mayor del matrimonio éste año se gradúa de Médico veterinario.
Respecto a las metas de su negocio, ella desea que su negocio crezca, para esto se propuso realizarlo en un plazo de un año. El sueño de Eliana a nivel personal es que sus 2 hijas menores continúen estudios superiores. Es por esto que sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio son obtener mayores ganancias, para poder brindarles un mejor bienestar a sus hijas y costear sus estudios. 
Eliana está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, además disfruta y aprende mucho de las reuniones y capacitaciones realizadas.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
Eliana is part of the "Arco Iris" ("Rainbow") community bank, located in the city of Osorno. She works in retail. She has had a small convenience store for the last 2 years. She buys her merchandise in bulk from distributors, which is more convenient price wise. She works from 9 in the morning to 10 in the evening, Monday to Saturday. With this loan she plans to buy school supplies and an assortment of meats and vegetables. 

Eliana lives with her ​​husband and three daughters aged 28, 22 and 13 years old. Her eldest daughter is graduating this year from vet school. With regards to her business goals, she wants her bushiness to grow in the coming year. Eliana's personal goal is for her two younger daughters to achieve higher education. That's why her motivation in continuing the business is to obtain higher profits, so as to provide her children with a better education and pay for their studies.

Eliana is very grateful for the credit granted by Fondo Esperanza. She also enjoys the meetings and has learned a great deal in the trainings conducted. 

Osorno is city in southern Chile, in the lakes region. It is an important agricultural centre known in Chile as "the homeland of milk and land of meat". The most important activities in the region are wheat and oat farming, livestock for meat processing and dairy production and the manufacture of agricultural equipment. Osorno is also known for having the only roofed football stadium in Chile, the Estadio Municipal Rubén Marcos.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and an assortment of meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Sixto Vicente

texts.es:
Sixto de 53 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su tricimoto (transporte urbano que utiliza las personas para ir a lugares difíciles para un carro). 

Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm, transportando a personas del barrio por donde viven al centro de Playas y otros lugares cercanos. Su tarifa por persona es de $ 0.50, si es por carga $ 1.00. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su tricimoto por eso quiere continuar trabajando y comprar con el préstamo llantas, carrocería y darle mantenimiento.  En el futuro quiere tener una cooperativa de taxis para darle una buena vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sixto, 53, is a hard-working man with high aspirations for his moto-taxi (the urban transportation people use to go places that are hard for cars to get to).

Sixto works from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening, transporting people from their neighborhoods to the beaches or other nearby areas.  His fare is $0.50 per person, and $1.00 per load.  He has high ambitions for his taxi, so he wants to keep working and use his loan to buy tires and a cart body to fix the moto up.  In the future, Sixto would like to have a taxi co-op so he can give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy tires and a cart body.

loans.name: Mujeres De Cuatro Caminos Group

texts.en:
Graciela A. T. D. I. is married and has two children. She cares for her home and her two children and also runs a small store selling clothing. Her husband is also a merchant and helps support the family. 

Graciela is requesting a loan as a part of the ¨Mujeres D. Cuatro Caminos Group¨ (Women of the Four Roads) to purchase more adult and children´s clothing for sale in her store. She has six years experience working in her store and started her business selling smaller items. She hopes to expand her store and sell a wiD. variety of goods in the future. 

Graciela and the other members of this group are involved in the following business activities: animal raising, clothing sales and fruit and vegetable sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es: Yoni de 29 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri; esta casado con Jenny de 25 años de edad y tienen 02 hijas Sharleni de 06 y Yasmin de 04 años, juntos viven en su propia casa situado en la comunidad de Nueva Esperanza caserío del distrito de Quimbiri. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra es por ello que es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo, Yoni es campesino cuenta 05 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de cacao y café. Viene trabajando 07 años en sus propias tierras, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta  con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos extraídos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centro de acopio con animales de carga; el animal burro es su medio de trasporte haciendo un recorrido de 03 horas de caminata hasta llegar a los centros de acopio. Cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias así impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando los frutos de sus plantaciones. Crédito solicitado es para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para así mejorar sus productos; además en el futuro anhela ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao de manera tecnificada. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y esta dispuesto a seguir cumpliendo con sus cronogramas de pago, ya que gracias a los préstamos que otorga la institución logrará adquirir muchos beneficios. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono, estiércol y fertilizantes, para mejorar la producción de sus plantas cacao y café.
texts.en:
Yoni, 29, is originally from the Quimbiri district. He is married to Jenny, 25, and they have two daughters, Sharleni, 6, and Yasmin, 4. They live in their own home, located in the Nueva Esperanza community, a village in the district of Quimbiri. 

From his childhood his parents taught him to work on the farm, so he knows the hard field work very well. Yoni is a farmer and owns 5 hectares of land with coffee and cocoa plants. He has worked in his land for 7 years. During harvest time he has the support of labourers who harvest the fruits and transport them. What he enjoys the most about his work is harvesting, as he feels that the quality of his produce is the reward for months of hard work. What he considers most  difficult  is transporting the produce on animals from the farm to the collection centres. He uses donkeys in the 3 hour walk to the collection centres.  

He says that he doesn't like winter, which brings insects and rain that hinder his work and damage his crops. The requested loan is to buy fertilisers to improve his produce. In future he would also like to expand his cocoa crops using machinery. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is willing to fulfill the payment schedule, as the loans granted by the organisation will benefit him highly. With the 2.000 soles requested he will buy fertilizer and manure to improve the productivity of his cocoa  and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and manure to improve his cocoa  and coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Lorena Julieta

texts.es:
La señora Lorena Julieta Resales tiene ya mas un año dedicándose a su negocio de abarrotes este es la fuente de ingreso de su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en comprar variedad de mecánica que le están solicitando sus clientes ya que para ella es muy importante satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y así le sigan consumiendo en su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su negocio, ya que tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y desea darles el estudio necesario para su futuro.
texts.en:
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su negocio, ya que tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y desea darles el estudio necesario para su futuro.

Lorena Julieta Resales has had her grocery business for over one year.  It is the source of income for her family.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy a variety of merchandise that her customers are requesting.  It is very important to her that she satisfy her customers’ needs.  That way they continue making purchases from her business.

She plans to pay for the loan with part of the income that she gets from her business.  She has three children who are her responsibility, and she wishes to give them the education that is needed for their future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 36 años, es un joven noble y muy trabajador. Vive en casa de sus padres y lo que mas desea es ser un gran empresario. Desde su infancia Miguel, se ha dedicado a la costura, por ser oficio de sus padres. En la actualidad trabaja en sociedad con su madre y su hermana, quienes confeccionan mandiles de usos domésticos. Por ello, todos los días, desde las 3 de la madrugada, producen 300 mandiles en dos mañanas, a pedido de sus clientes de los diversos mercados informales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que lo realiza dentro de su casa, y eso le favorece en ahorrar y no gastar en el alquiler de un taller. Con sus ahorros y con tu ayuda pudo comprarse una maquina apropiada, que ahora su madre y su hermana realizan trabajos adicionales, como confeccionar las tiras de los mandiles; por ser muy trabajoso este detalle. Por el momento,  le hacen falta más telas, para abastecer sus pedidos y en adelante quiere poner una puerta principal para tener seguridad. Este es su 12avo crédito que tiene MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, considerando éste crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más telas delgadas, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 36, is a very honest and hard-working young man.  He lives in his parents’ house, and what he wants most of all is to be a great businessman.  Ever since his childhood Miguel has been sewing, as this is his parents’ occupation.

He currently works with his mother and his sister making aprons for home use.  He works every day starting at three in the morning.  They produce 300 aprons in two mornings.  These are customer orders from different informal markets.  What he likes the most about his work is that he does it in his house.  This helps him to save and not spend money on renting a shop.

With his savings and your help, he was able to buy a suitable machine.  Now his mother and his sister do extra work like making the straps for the aprons.  This detail is very laborious work.

They now need more fabric in order to fill their orders.  Later, he wants to install a main door for safety.

This is his 12th loan with MFP.  He pledges to make all of his payments on time.  This loan is very useful to the progress of his business.  He will use the requested loan to buy more thin fabric to fill the pending orders that he has.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: Brillantes Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”BRILLANTES ESTRELLAS”, está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Luordes. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos venta de comida, trenzado y tejido de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de verduras, confección de deportivos, venta de coca.

La presidenta, la señora Luordes vive en concubinato y es madre de dos hijos. Esta es su primera experiencia en el trabajo con asociaciones comunales; con el préstamo que realizará comprará materia prima, telas; pues ella confecciona deportivos, los que vende diariamente por pedidos. 

Ella nos cuenta que la materia prima la compra de la galería el CEIBO, por que es mas barato; también menciona que para el manejo del negocio le ayuda su  esposo.

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora Lourdes responde  el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Brillantes Estrellas” (Shining Stars) Communal Bank is starting its first cycle in the Los Andes Community Center.  Eight members participate in this communal bank.  Luordes is the president of the board of directors.

The women have different businesses.  They sell food, braid and weave blankets, have a grocery store, sell vegetables, make sportswear, and sell coca.
