Luordes, the president, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  This is her first experience working with communal banks.  She will use the loan to buy fabric.  She makes sportswear, and she sells it by order daily.  She tells us that she buys the raw material from the CEIBO gallery because it is cheaper.  She also mentions that her husband helps her manage the business.

When we asked her what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, Luordes said, “The loan”.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Martha Vannessa

texts.es:
Martha de 22 años, es una mujer trabajadora ya que vende productos de uso personal por catalogo a diferentes clientes fijos que ella tiene. 

Su papa le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas ya que la ayudo con la comprar de los productos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días. Ofrece los productos a clientes cerca del sector donde vive. Vende perfumes, cremas, lociones, bisutería etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc.
texts.en:
Martha is 22 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who sells personal care products, through catalogs, to regular customers.

Martha's dad helped her to improve her sales since he helped her buy products.  She currently works from 8.00am to 1.00pm every day.  Martha sells her products to customers who live near her neighborhood.  She sells perfumes, creams, lotions, costume jewelry, etc.

Martha has many aspirations for her business.  She would like this loan to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Silvana Maribel

texts.es: La señora Silvana Maribel B. M. trabaja en una imprenta el negocio empezó con ayuda de sus padres sin embargo aun mantiene todos los datos del negocio a nombre de sus papas ,es casada su esposo maneja una moto taxi eL cual es propio su meta a futuro es hacer crecer mas su negocio de imprenta para que le genere mayores ingresos tiene buenas referencias ,el dinero del prestamos sera invertido en darle mantenimiento a su moto taxi para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes ,se propone crédito por ser persona responsable y con ganas de salir adelante al lado de su familia.
texts.en: Silvana Maribel B. M. has a printing business.  She started her business with her parents' help and still keeps it all in her parents' name.  Silvana is married and her husband drives a motorcycle taxi which he owns.  Silvana's goal for the future is to grow her printing business so that she can make more income.  She has good references and the loan money will be invested in having maintenance work done on the motorcycle taxi so that her husband could provide a better service to his customers. She is a responsible person who wants to help her family succeed.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for the car's engine

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 4 Group

texts.en:
Alejandrina is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz 4 (love and peace). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to travel to other cities.

Alejandrina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods for daily meals. She operates a Colmado (a small food store). She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save because she wants to build a house. She is dreaming of having her own safe structure and living tranquilly with her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying her business.

Alejandrina's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, flour, beans, etc

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Nicolasa L. le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así poder relazar la mejora que necesita, ya a la señora Nicolasa L. y a su esposo el señor Evaristo Linares les esta preocupa la seguridad y el bienestar de su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene Don Evaristo como chofer de camión de carretera.
texts.en: Nicolasa L.' house needs a perimeter wall but right now she doesn't have the money she needs to buy materials and pay the person who will carry out the improvement.  She is requesting a loan which will allow her to have the necessary work done as Nicolasa L. and her husband Evaristo Linares are worried about their family's safety and well-being.  She plans to repay her loan with the income that Evaristo makes as a truck driver.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Marias Del Rosario Group

texts.en:
Norma Ninet is 37 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are currently studying in school. She cares for her home and her children but has also started running a small general store to supplement her family's income. Her husband works as a security guard to help support the family. 

Norma started her business selling small products from her home four years ago and would now like to stock her small store so that her business may have a chance to grow. She hopes to one day run a local store with a variety of goods.

Norma is a member of the Marias del R. Group. This is group's second loan through ASDIR, and the previous loan was paid back in full with no problems. Other members of the group are involved in the following activities: animal raising, farming, and general goods sales.

loans.use: to stock the general store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una joven madre de 25 años, vive al lado de su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez, junto a su familia cultivan principalmente papa y otros productos más como el maíz, avena, trigo, alfalfa entre otros y  constantemente cuidan el crecimiento de sus plantas   y  extraer las malezas que pueden perjudicar la buena cosecha. Asimismo se apoyan económicamente de la crianza de animales como ovejas, chanchos y cuyes que vende ocasionalmente de acuerdo a su necesidad. De esta manera ha logrado mejorar con el paso del tiempo la producción de sus cosechas  que lleva a vender directamente a los mercados mas cercanos de su localidad, considera que la actividad agrícola es muy beneficiosa para su familia ya que  tiene disponible el alimento para su propio consumo aunque tiene deseos de incursionar en otro tipo de negocio como el de abarrotes al por mayor aprovechando que  parte de sus cultivos será su mercadería disponible. Es su  segunda vez  que solicita un crédito con MFP  de manera individual y ha  tenido una buena experiencia  de  su anterior crédito ya que supo darle una buena inversión y mejorar su producción. Ahora invertirá su crédito en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
María is a young woman of 25 who lives with her husband and son in her own home.  She has been farming with her family since she was a child, mainly growing potatoes and crops such as corn, oats, wheat, alfalfa, etc.  She constantly cares for her growing crops and gets rid of the weeds that can damage a good harvest.  María also supports herself financially by raising animals such as sheep, pigs and guinea pigs which she sells occasionally as the need arises

Over time, María has managed to improve her crop production.  She takes her harvested crops and sells them directly in the markets nearest her town.  She considers farming to be very beneficial to her family since they have food available for their own consumption.  However, she would also like to break into another type of business.  María would like to sell groceries wholesale, taking advantage of the fact that some of her crops would count as available merchandise.

This is the second time that María has requested a loan from MFP as an individual.  She had a good experience with her previous loan since she was able to make a good investment and improve her production.  She will invest this loan in buying sacks of manure for her next growing season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus 2 Group

texts.en:
Alexandra is the coordinator of her group Caminando con J. 2 (Walking with J.). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to buy land to start building her house and stop paying rent. 

Alexandra is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She is starting a clothing sales business with this loan she is receiving. She is planning to invest by purchasing women's clothes like blouses, shirts, skirts, jeans, underwear, and many others items. She will use the profits to save because her plans are to use those savings to buy the land they want. Her family dreams of living in a beautiful house, big and clean. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she has dreams and she wants to help her long-term partner in this plan. By working in her new business, with savings and loans, she can make her dreams come true. 

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 47 años, vive al lado de su esposa y el menor de sus hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 15 años de experiencia en la confección de diversas prendas de vestir, su taller de confecciones esta en su misma casa en la cual todos los días trabaja en compañía de su esposa y su hijo, mientras tenga tiempo libre de estudio. Con los años de experiencia ha adquirido  destrezas  favorables en la calidad de su producción y adquirir más clientela mejorando así sus ventas, también se obligó así mismo a identificar las mejores oportunidades de negocio en el rubro de trabajo que se desempeña por lo que eligió confeccionar  gorros deportivos, que es una  de las prendas más usadas en su zona y lo que produce rápidamente se llega a vender. Su forma de venta es al por mayor a los comerciantes  minoristas, siempre recibe las sugerencias y aportes en cuanto a las preferencias en diseños y tiene el gran sueño de tener un taller grande de confecciones y tener más lugares de ventas. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, se siente muy contento y respaldado financieramente ya que considera que acceder a un crédito es la llave al acceso de mejores oportunidades de inversión y crecimiento de su negocio por lo que esta agradecido. Con el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos necesarios e incrementar su producción de gorros como telas de diferentes colores, hilos y plantillas de gorros deportivos.
texts.en: Jose is 47 years old and lives with his wife, and the youngest of their children, in their own home.  He has 15 years of experience making various types of clothing.  He runs his shop from his home, which lets him work every day in the company of his wife and son, while he also has some free time to study.  With the years of experience he's gained, his high quality work has helped him grow his customer base and increase his sales.   It has also let him identify the best opportunities, such as sport caps, which are very popular in the region and easy to produce quickly and sell.   He sells his caps wholesale to the small shops, who provide him with suggestions on the latest preferences and designs.    Jose's dream is to have a larger business serving even more shops.    This is his second loan with MFP, and Jose feels content that he has this financial support, especially since these loans are key for him to grow his business.  He appreciates this support.   With this loan he will purchase materials needed to increase his production of caps, such as fabrics in different colros, strings, and sports logos.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabric and string needed to make his sports caps.

loans.name: Edgar Manuel

texts.es:
Edgar Manuel V. R., es soltero, tiene 26 años de edad, esta graduado como profesional, se dedica a cortar cabello, tiene ya 10 años con su negocio, nició siendo trabajado para otra barberia, pero actualmente cuneta con su propio negocio. 

Quiere apertura otra barberia, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar
texts.en: Edgar is 26 years old and single.  He graduated from a professional school and works as a barber.  He has been doing this work for 10 years and would now like to open another barber shop.  He is requesting the loan to grow his business.

loans.use: To invest in a second barber shop and grow his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computer equipment for her business

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela es una joven profesional de 23  años, vive al lado de su Mamá en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a la costura y tiene su propio taller en su casa, recibe pedidos de instituciones educativas para  hacer en serie los uniformes de acuerdo a las exigencias que demandan cada centro educativo. Realiza convenios para que su producción sea óptima, también ofrece sus servicios a diversas instituciones y para aumentar sus contactos de sus clientes que le permite seguir adelante cuenta con la ayuda de su hermano. En adelante desea incrementar su red de clientela para que sus ingresos sean aún más estables. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP,  es un crédito individual la que solicita y promete ser puntual en sus pagos. Esta conciente que debe realizar una buena inversión, en esta ocasión será destinada a la compra de tela al por mayor y el pago del mantenimiento de su maquina de coser.
texts.en: Mayela is a young professional who is 23-years-old and lives alongside her mother in her parent’s house.  More than two years ago, she began working as a seamstress and she has her own workshop in her house.  She gets orders from educational institutions to make their uniforms following the requirements of each educational center.  She makes deals so that her production can be optimized and also offers her services to a variety of institutions and in order to expand her contacts with customers.  She has the help of her brother so that she can get ahead with this.  Looking forward, she would like to expand her customer network so that she can have a more stable income.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is requesting an individual loan and promises to be punctual in her payments.  She is aware that she should make a good investment.  This time it will be put towards the wholesale purchase of fabric and paying for the maintenance for her sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy fabric and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana forma parte del Banco comunal “Compartiendo Esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna. Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería por catálogo, desde hace 4 años aproximadamente. Durante este tiempo su clientela ha ido en aumento, por lo que ahora cuenta con 40 clientes frecuentes.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en una tienda mayorista, donde los precios son a bajo costo.
Viviana además estudia en un instituto la carrera de Trabajo Social, por lo que acomoda los horarios de su negocio, de acuerdo a sus estudios.
Con el préstamo comprará lencería para la temporada de otoño.
Ella vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad.
Su sueño es terminar de estudiar su carrera y expandir su negocio, con el que podrá optar a una vida más confortable.
Viviana postuló a un subsidio para la vivienda, la cual se la entregan en los próximos meses. 
Su motivación de continuar con éste negocio es poder concretar todos sus proyectos, generados por las ganancias de éste. 
Viviana está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le ayudará a invertir en su negocio. Y las reuniones le han servido para aprender a como distribuir mejor sus ingresos. Además está contenta porque su grupo es muy organizado y unido. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Viviana is part of the communal bank “Compartiendo Esfuerzo” (Sharing Effort) which is in the city of La Cisterna.  She works selling lingerie from catalogs and has done this for approximately the last four years. During this time, her clientele has grown so that now she has 40 frequent customers.
She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago in a wholesale store where the prices are low.
Viviana also studies social work in an educational institution, thus she adjusts the hours she works in her business according to her studies.
With the loan she will buy lingerie for the fall season.
She lives with her husband and their two children who are 13 and 4-years-old.
Her dream is to get her degree and expand her business so that she can have a more comfortable life.  
Viviana applied for a subsidy for her house which she will receive in a few months.  
Her motivation for continuing with this business is to be able to complete her projects with the income generated by the business.
Viviana is very thankful to Fondo Esperanza as the loan will help her to invest in her business.  Also, the meetings have helped her to learn how to better distribute her income.  Additionally she is happy because her group is very organized and united.
La Cisterna is a community located in the central-south sector of the Metropolitan area.  It is a primarily residential and commercial community.  In the beginning it was a rural area with large land parcels, but due to the population growth and the arrival of services it became a 100% urban area.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel se llama así porque las personas que integran el grupo son devotas a este santo, además de que su población se llama San Miguel Tetepelcingo, una población muy hermosa donde todas las personas hablan la lengua indígena, y la mayoría de las mujeres se dedican a al elaboración de servilletas y manteles, este grupo esta integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras que se dedican al bordado de manteles y servilletas. 
La representante de este grupo es la señora Herlinda A. López de 39 años de edad quien esta casada con el señor Martín Barragán Mejia quien se dedica al campo, tiene 3 hijos. 
Herlinda se dedica a la elaboración de bordado de manteles, también se dedica a vender tamales los días lunes, miércoles y viernes, para así poder tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa.
Otra de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Verónica Hernández López de 27 años de edad quien esta casada con el señor Bonifacio Hernández Hernández quien se dedica al campo, tiene 3 hijos pequeños ella se dedica  al bordado de servilletas y manteles con la técnica del telar, para realizar cada uno de estos productos se llevan varios días, ella comenta que últimamente le va muy bien, para que Verónica venda sus productos tiene que trasladarse a la Pinotepa Nacional para venderlo en el mercado que esta a un hora de distancia de su población.  Verónica tiene 8 años realizando esta actividad ya que es una herencia que le dejo su mamá ya que esta técnica se va pasando de generación en generación. Ella sueña que sus hijos sean unos profesionistas para que así tengan mejores oportunidades. También de igual manera quisiera que sus productos se vendieran internacionalmente ya que son artesanías hermosas realizadas con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. La ganancia que obtiene de sus productos es para aportar dinero en su familia ya que con lo que obtiene su esposo no es suficiente, como el se dedica  al campo casi no obtienen dinero a veces solo hay para comer y es por ello que Verónica decido hacer sus productos y venderlos para así poderse ayudar.
Las personas de este grupo agradecen a todos los que apoyan a la fundacion para que así ellos de igual manera puedan ayudar a prestarles a gentes humildes que lo necesitan.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Verónica, Leonila, Margarita, Maria López, Feliza, Francisca, Abelina, Lucia, Angélica, Delfina, Rosa, Maria, Margarita Hernández se dedican a la elaboración de servilletas.
Herlinda A. López: De 39 años de edad  quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
Adelfa Avendaño J.: De 66 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de refresco para la venta.
texts.en:
This group is called 'San Miguel' because the group's members are devotees of this saint.  Also, their town is called San Miguel Tepelcingo.  It is a very beautiful town where everybody speaks the indigenous language and most of the women work making napkins and tablecloths.  This group is made up of 15 very hard-working women who embroider tablecloths and napkins.

This group's representative is 39 year-old Herlinda A. López who is married to Martín Barragán Mejia who works in agriculture.  They have three children.  Herlinda's business is embroidering tablecloths.  She also sells tamales on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays in order to make more income and help her husband with their household expenses.

27 year-old Verónica Hernández López is another member of this group. She is married to Bonifacio Hernández Hernández who works in agriculture.  They have 3 young children and Verónica works embroidering napkins and tablecloths using a loom.  It takes her several days to make each of these products.  She tells us that lately her business has been doing very well.  In order to sell her products, Verónica must travel to Pinotepa Nacional where she sells them in the market.  This is one hour away from her town.

Verónica has been engaged in this business activity for 8 years.  She inherited it from her mom since it is a technique that is passed down from generation to generation.  Verónica dreams that her children will become professionals so that they will have better opportunities in life.  She would also like to see her products sell internationally since they are beautiful handicrafts that are made with a lot of effort and dedication.  Verónica uses the profits that she makes on her products to provide her family with money since her husband's income does not stretch far enough.  As he works in agriculture, they don't make much money and sometimes there is only enough money for food.  Verónica decided to make her products and sell them in order to help out.

The members of this group are grateful to everybody who supports Fundación so that they too can help lend to humble people who need it.  The members of this group are as follows: Verónica, Leonila, Margarita, Maria López, Feliza, Francisca, Abelina, Lucia, Angélica, Delfina, Rosa, Maria and Margarita Hernández make napkins.  39 year-old Herlinda A. López buys supplies to make and sell tamales and 66 year-old Adelfa Avedaño J. buys soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and selling tamales

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda forma parte del Banco comunal “Compartiendo Esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas de pino, ave y napolitana, desde hace 2 años y 6 meses. Trabaja junto a su esposo quien las vende en lugares concurridos de gente, específicamente en una feria libre. Ellos trabajan de lunes a sábado. Y en temporada de la fiesta costumbrista de Chile, que es el 18 de septiembre, su clientela realiza pedidos al por mayor.

Con el préstamo comprará un fogón (cocinilla para freír) 
Su sueño es construir un local en el patio de su casa, para vender al mesón sus empanadas, durante los fines de semana, además le gustaría expandirse y tener una fábrica de empanadas. Donde además pudiera ofrecerle trabajo a mucha gente.

Bernarda vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 24, 23 y 8 años.
Su motivación de continuar con éste negocio es obtener su casa propia y generar más ganancias.

Bernarda está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá  invertir en su negocio. Y las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender a como distribuir sus ingresos. Además está contenta porque ha conocido gente nueva.

La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a member of the “Compartiendo Esfuerzo” (Sharing Effort) community bank which is located in the town of La Cisterna.  Her business is selling empanadas filled with 'pino' (fried ground beef and onion), poultry and 'napolitana' (spicy pork sausage and cheese).  She has been in this business for two and a half years.  She works together with her husband who sells their products in busy places, specifically in an open air street market.  They work from Monday to Saturday.  During the 'fiesta costumbrista' festivities in Chile which are celebrated on September 18th, her customers make wholesale orders.

Bernarda will use this loan to buy a stove for frying food.  Her dream is to build a sales location in her yard where she can sell her empanadas on weekends.  She would also like to expand her business and own an empanada factory where she could offer jobs to a lot of people.  Bernada lives with her husband and her three children aged 24, 23 and 8.  Her motivation for continuing in this business is her desire to own her own home and make more profits.

Bernada is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza because her loan will allow her to invest in her business.  The training sessions she has attended have helped her to learn how to distribute her income.  She is also happy because she has met new people.

La Cisterna is a town which is located in the central-south sector of the Metropolitana region of Chile.  It is an essentially residential and commercial town.  Originally, it was a rural area made up of large plots of land.  However, owing to the growth in its population and the arrival of services, it has become a 100% urban area.

loans.use: to buy a stove for frying food

loans.name: Aída

texts.es:
Aída forma parte del Banco comunal “Compartiendo Esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 4 años y vende artículos de aseo, específicamente; shampoo, jabón, confort, detergente, paños de cocina, esponjas, escobillas, cloro, desodorante ambiental en aerosol, líquido para limpiar piso y fósforos, entre otros.  
Aída trabaja junto a su esposo, quién se encarga de trasladar la mercadería en un vehículo particular que tienen ambos. Sus artículos los vende en diferentes ferias libres, cuatro veces a la semana (los días miércoles, jueves, sábados y domingos). Aída tiene mucha clientela, entre ellos  vecinos y conocidos incluso van a su casa a comprar sus artículos. 
Con el préstamo comprará artículos de aseo al por mayor y en grandes cantidades. 
Su sueño es agrandar su negocio, de manera de abastecer su bodega y poder trabajar seis días a la semana. 
Aída vive con su marido y su hijo de 14 años, quien estudia en la educación media. Además tiene una hija que está separada y tiene 3 hijos (sus nietos), a quienes ayuda en la manutención alimenticia de ellos. Por lo que sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio son proveer a su familia de alimentación y brindarles un mejor bienestar, además de entregarles una mejor calidad en la educación.
Aída está muy contenta del préstamo de Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido un apoyo fundamental para su negocio, respecto a las reuniones que sostiene con su grupo, ella ha logrado generar lazos de amistad. Y con las capacitaciones ha aprendido a distribuir y organizar de mejor manera sus ingresos generados por su negocio. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Aída is a member of the “Compartiendo Esfuerzo” (Sharing Effort) community bank which is located in the town of La Cisterna.  She has been a saleswoman for 4 years and sells toiletries and cleaning products, specifically shampoo, soap, fabric softener, detergents, teatowels, sponges, brushes, bleach, air fresheners (aerosols), floor cleaner, matches, etc.

Aida works together with her husband who transports her merchandise in a private vehicle that they both own.  Aída sells her goods in different open air markets four times a week (Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays).  She has a lot of customers, including neighbors and acquaintances.  Some even come to her home to buy her goods.

Aída will use her loan to buy toiletries and cleaning products wholesale and in large quantities.  Her dream is to expand her business in order to stock her store and be able to work six days a week. 

Aída lives with her husband and her 14 year-old son who is in middle school.  She also has a daughter who lives independently and has 3 children (Aída's grandchildren) who she helps to feed.  Aída's motivation to continue in her business is the need to provide her family with food and provide them with a better well-being.  She would also like to provide them with a better quality education.

Aída is very happy with Fondo Esperanza's loans since they have been a key support for her business.  She has also managed to make friendships through her group meetings.  The training sessions have taught her how to better distribute and organize her business income.

La Cisterna is a town which is located in the central-south sector of Metropolitana region, in Chile.  It is an essentially residential and commercial town.  Originally it was a rural area made up of large plots of land.  However, owing to its population growth and the arrival of services, it has become a 100% urban area.

loans.use: to buy toiletries and cleaning products

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Mónica forma parte del Banco comunal “Compartiendo Esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna.
Ella se dedica al servicio de peluquería desde hace 8 años, trabaja en un local que tiene al lado de su departamento. El horario laboral de Mónica es de lunes a sábado por las tardes. Sin embargo la demanda de sus servicios son los días 15 y 30 de cada mes. Sus clientes frecuentes son varios y antiguos, ya que la mayoría de ellos son vecinos y conocidos.
Con el préstamo comprará productos profesionales de peluquería, específicamente; tinturas, decolorantes, crema de masajes capilares, tijeras y cancelar la cuenta de agua.
Mónica vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 21 y 9 años de edad.
El sueño de Mónica es tener un salón de belleza y Centro de estética, junto a su hija que estudió estética profesional. Sus motivaciones de seguir con el negocio es brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar.
Mónica está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá  invertir en su peluquería. A ella le encanta participar de las reuniones y talleres que brinda Fondo Esperanza.
 La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Mónica is part of the “Compartiendo Esfuerzo” community bank in the city of La Cisterna. She has been a hairdresser for eight years, working out of a small salon next to her apartment. She works Monday through Saturday in the afternoons. Her busiest times are the 15th and the 30th of every month. Mónica has various loyal customers, most of whom are neighbors and acquaintances. 

With this loan, she will buy professional salon products such as hair dyes, bleaching dyes, hair massage oil, and scissors. She will also be able to pay the water bill. Mónica lives with her husband and their two children, ages 21 and 9. 

Her dream is to open a beauty salon and aesthetics center with her daughter, who studied professional beauty care. Her motivation for owning this kind of business is to be able to improve her family's wellbeing. Mónica is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza for giving her the opportunity to invest in her business. She enjoys attending her group's meetings and the workshops provided by Fondo Esperanza.

La Cisterna is a town located in the south central sector of the Metropolitana region. It is primarily a residential and commercial town. Originally, La Cisterna was a rural area divided into large land plots, but due to population growth and the development of infrastructure it became completely urban.

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, bleaching dyes, hair massage oil, and scissors.

loans.name: Altamirano Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama “Altamirano”, es D. la comunidad D. San Pedro, San Felipe del progreso, el grupo lo integran 13 mujeres trabajadoras, las trece son casadas tienen su familia y son amas D. casa, pero también se dedican a criar animales como puercos, borregos, pollos y guajolotes,  lo hacen con la intención D. obtener ganancias y ayudar cuando se pueda con los gastos ya sea con los hijos en la escuela o con la despensa en la casa, también porque no trabajan y desean invertir parte del tiempo en algo que sea productivo y puedan apoyar a su esposo para que juntos salgan adelante con todas las necesidades que actualmente se tienen. La comunidad D. San Pedro  es una D. las comunidades mas avanzadas del Municipio, se cuenta con todos los servicios públicos como agua y drenajes, hospital, escuelas, gasolinera en fin es muy completa, y también es una comunidad que tiene mucho profesionista y muchos niños estudiando. El grupo decidió “Altamirano” porque es un nombre que les pueD. traer mucha suerte a todo el grupo, ya que es el nombre D. una parte D. Chiapas y también D. un escritor importante por eso llevan ese nombre. Los nombres D. las trece integrantes son:
1.-Concepción M. Mejía, tiene 30 años
2.-Carolina Sánchez Ramírez, 29 años
3.-Valentina B. Q. 40 años
4.-Maria Jacinta D. Jesús V. 56 años
5.-Elvira Sánchez R. 42 años
6.-Gabriela Solís García
7.-Paula R. G. 32 años
8.- Patricia Cruz Gutiérrez 33 años
9.-Guadalupe Q. Solís 20 años
10.-Victoria R. G. 25 años
11.-Yolanda B. López 47 años
12.-Teresa B. Q. 31 años
13.-Ana Rosa Severa S. 24 años.
La representante del grupo se llama Carolina, tiene 3 hijos, sus tres niños estudian la primaria, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo, acaba D. terminar su propia casa, con lo que ella podía ayudar con la venta D. sus animales y lo que su esposo gana hicieron su casa, aun hacen falta varias cosas pero es un gran paso el que dieron con su casa,  su esposo trabaja en un taxi, sale desD. muy temprano y regresa en la noche D. trabajar, doña Carolina se dedica a la cría D. borregos, nos platica que le va bien criando los animales porque le dejan ganancias los animales y no se le hace difícil cuidarlos y criarlos, todo lo contrario, el préstamo va beneficiar mucho porque va comprar borregos ya que en este momento no tiene, los que tenía ya los vendió y se quedo sin invertir, también es un bien para la familia ya que va tener ganancias para después ocuparlas en la casa para irla arreglando.  La meta que tiene es poder terminar bien su casa que no le haga falta nada y mejorar la calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This group, called “Altamirano”, is from the community of San Pedro in San Felipe del Progreso. The group is comprised of 13 hardworking women. All 13 are married. They have their families and are housewives, but they are also involved in raising animals such as pigs, sheep, chickens, and turkeys. They do this to obtain income and to help when they can with expenses, whether for their children in school or the needs of the household. Also, because they don’t have full time jobs they want to invest part of their time in something that is productive and that supports their husbands so that together they can progress, getting all the necessities of life that they currently need.

The community of San Pedro is one of the most advanced communities in the municipality. It has all the public services, like water and drains, a hospital, schools, and a service station. In short, it is very complete and is also a community that has a lot of professionals and young students. The group decided on the name Altamirano because it is a name which can bring a lot of luck to all its members since it is the name of a part of Chiapas and also of an important writer. The thirteen members are:

1.-Concepción M. Mejía, age 30 2.-Carolina Sánchez Ramírez, age 29 3.-Valentina B. Q., age 404.-Maria Jacinta D. Jesús V., age 56 5.-Elvira Sánchez R., age 42 6.-Gabriela Solís García 7.-Paula R. G., age 32 8.- Patricia Cruz Gutiérrez, age 33 9.-Guadalupe Q. Solís, age 20 10.-Victoria R. G., age 25 11.-Yolanda B. López, age 47 12.-Teresa B. Q., age 31 13.-Ana Rosa Severa S., age 24

Carolina is a representative of this group. She has 3 children who study in primary school. She lives in a common law relationship with her husband. They have just built their own house, and she can help out by selling her animals. What her husband earns will pay for the house. Though they lack several things having the house is a big step. Her husband drives a taxi, leaving very early and returning late.

Doña Carolina raises lambs. She tells us that her business is doing well because it brings in income, and it is not difficult to care for the animals. The loan will bring great benefit because she is going to purchase lambs since, at the moment, she doesn’t have any. She sold what she had and the family needs income after building the house. Her goals are to be able to finish their house so that it lacks nothing and to improve her family’s quality of lif

loans.use: to buy lambs.

loans.name: San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Doña Rosario T. Y., es una señora casada, tiene 41 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos y estudian, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, es ama D. casa, pero se dedica a la crianza D. animales, en este caso pollos, cuenta con 2 años D. experiencia. 

DeciD. organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamos para comprar mas pollos, las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades: crianza D. animales y la venta D. tomates, esperan que con el préstamo que solocitan mejorar su negocio y su condicion D. vida, quieren ver su negocio en el futuro con muchos animales y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario T. Y. is 41 years old and married.  She has five children who are students.  She herself did not have the opportunity to be a student.  She is a housewife and works as an animal breeder, in this case chickens.  She has two years' experience.

Rosario organized a group with the goal of requesting funds to buy more chickens.  The members of this group work in different occupations such as animal breeding and tomato sales.  They hope that with the loan they are seeking they can improve their respective businesses and quality of life.  They envision owning many animals and having better earnings in the future.

loans.use: to buy some chickens for breeding

loans.name: Villa Paraiso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA PARAÍSO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza de la señora Norah.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra de minibús, tienda de abarrotes, tienda, mantas en macramé, venta de comida, venta de jugos; construcción de casa y sacar papeles.

La señora Norah tiene como negocio el tejido de mantas y con el crédito que sacará ahora pretende comprar mas lanas de la feria 16 de julio. Cuando sus productos ya estén elaborados los comercializará en la feria de Patacamaya, Viacha, 16 de Julio, Laguna, todos lo días.

En la actualidad la señora tiene treinta y dos años, vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos, pero el negocio lo realiza sola. Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The community association “VILLA PARAÍSO” is beginning its second loan cycle at the Panamericana focal center. The group is made up of eight members. It is part of a community association, made up of a few groups and run by an executive committee, led by Norah.

The group members run various businesses: public transportation, grocery store, general store, sales of macramé blankets, food sales, juice sales, construction, and preparation of official documents.

Norah weaves blankets and plans to buy wool from the 16 de Julio market with the loan. After weaving her blankets, she sells them every day in the Patacamaya, Viacha, 16 de Julio, and Laguna markets.

Norah is 32 years old and lives with her significant other and three children. She runs her business by herself. When asked if she likes working with Pro Mujer, Norah responded that she likes everything about Pro Mujer.

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia   es una clienta antigua de la institución y  ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación que se le hizo,   La clienta cuenta con su propio vehículo (minibús), que se encuentra inscrito en le sindicato mini sur de la ciudad de la Paz Para la subsistencia de la familia ellos trabajan de horas 6:00 am a 20:00 pm, el esposo es quien conduce el vehículo y la señora Virginia es la ayudante quien cobra los pasajes y administra los ingresos del día,  es sacrificado el esfuerzo que ellos realizan para tener mejores condiciones de vida,  el mayor sueño de la familia es llegar a tener un  patrimonio estable y que sus hijos lleguen a tener una carrera profesional, por lo que se esfuerzan en lograrlo día a día, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Virginia realizara el mantenimiento de su minibús, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. OJO: en la foto se encuentra junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Virginia is a long-standing client of our institution.  She has always shown a willingness to make her repayments and was kind and polite during her evaluation.  Our client owns her own vehicle (a minibus) and is a member of the Mini Sur drivers' union in the city of La Paz.  In order to provide for their family, Virginia and her husband work from 6.00am to 8.00pm.  Virginia's husband drives the vehicle and Virginia is his assistant.  She collects fares and manages the day's takings.  Their efforts require a lot of sacrifice but they carry out their work in order to attain better living conditions.  The family's biggest dream is to be in a stable financial situation and for their children to become professionals.  They work hard every day to achieve this.  Virginia will use her loan money to have some maintenance work carried out on the minibus.  Virginia is a very hard-workiing person.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

Note: Virginia appears in this photo together with her husband.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on her vehicle (changing the piston rings)

loans.name: Mercedes María

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo, está rodeada por maravillosas playas de clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras.

Aquí conocimos a la señora  Mercedes, ella tiene 60 años y está casada hace ya 34 años, no pudo tener hijos pero tiene tres chicos  que crio desde pequeños como si fueran suyos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una linda niña de 6 años que está en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en la cooperativa Coactur.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza y perfumería) y Leonisa (ropa interior para damas). Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, dice que ya lleva en el negocio de Yanbal 14 años y que tuvo varios problemas al principio pero que ahora ya no gracias a que tiene muchos clientes, pero en las prendas intimas recién comenzó hace poco, además nos cuenta que con el crédito anterior también empezó a vender prendas de damas y ahora tiene muchos pedidos.

Con este crédito lo va  ir Guayaquil y  a Quito a comprar ropa de damas ya que tiene varios pedidos y quiere aumentar sus clientes. Es su sexto  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos crece en su negocio.

Su meta es seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The May 8th Community Bank meets every other week in the beautiful city of Portoviejo. It is surrounded by marvelous beaches with a warm and pleasant climate, and has beautiful and spirited women. Here we find Mrs. Mercedes. She is 60 years old and has been married for 34 years. She could not have children but has raised three children since they were young as if they were her own. Two of them are now grown and the other, a lovely girl, is six years old and in school. Her husband works for Coactur.

She works selling Yanbal beauty products and Leonisa, a brand of women's underwear. She works every day in the afternoon. She says she has had her Yanbal business for 14 years and that at the beginning there were problems with it but not any longer thanks to her many customers. She only recently began selling lingerie, and shared that her last loan helped her begin selling it, and that she now has many orders.

With this loan she will go to Guayaquil and Quito to buy women's clothing since she has many orders and also wants to increase her clientele. This is her sixth loan with the Community Bank and she likes it because the loans help her business grow. Her goal is to keep moving forward with her business.

loans.use: buy women's clothing

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 52 años, vive con el menor de sus 5 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años decidió tener su tienda de abarrotes en su casa, aprovechando la ubicación estratégica  donde vive, ya que hay muy afluencia de gente. Desde entonces, todos los días atiende su establecimiento con ayuda de su madre  y su hijo. Ella esta siempre atenta y prevé que mercadería le hace falta para realizar el pedido a sus proveedores. Por otro lado, también posee dentro de su tienda, el servicio de locutorio, negocio que atrae a más clientela. Eso le ha favorecido mucho en las ganancias, sin embrago una de sus mayores dificultades  es el alza constante de los productos, por eso trata de abastecerse de variados productos que sean del alcanza de la economía de sus clientes. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, tiene gratas experiencias de haber solicitado un crédito anteriormente ya que le ayudó a mejorar su negocio de la cual se siente muy agradecida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería  para su tienda.
texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old and lives with the youngest of her 5 children and her husband in her own home.  Ten years ago, Nancy decided to set up a grocery store in her home, taking advantage of the strategic location of her home which is in a very busy area.  Since then, she has worked in her store every day, with the help of her mother and her son.  Nancy is always attentive and keeps an eye on what merchandise she needs so that she can place orders with her suppliers.  Inside her store, Nancy also has a 'locutorio' (public telephone service) which attracts more customers.  This has really helped her profits.  However, one of the biggest difficulties she faces is the constant increase in the price of her products.  For this reason, she tries to stock up with a variety of products that are within financial reach of her customers.

This is Nancy's third loan with MFP.  She had a good experience with her previous loan since it helped her to improve her business.  She is very grateful for that.  Nancy will invest this loan in buying merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana forma parte del banco comunal “Nuestros inicios” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo sopaipillas, empanadas, completos, mermeladas, pasteles y confites que ella misma realiza. Sin embargo ahora el kiosco en el cual vendía sus productos, se encuentra en reparaciones, ya que se desarmaron unas latas de éste. Mientras tanto sigue en el mismo rubro del comercio, pero relacionado con la picaduría y venta de leña, además de vender y realizar chocolates, mermeladas, kuchen y galletas. Su esposo e hija ayudan en el negocio, ya que ambos venden los productos de Adriana en sus respectivos trabajos. Por su parte Adriana vende directamente desde su casa, colaciones y desayunos que le solicitan sus clientes.
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en supermercados, con esto se abastece de ingredientes para sus productos. La leña la compra en casa particulares.
Con el préstamo comprará materiales de construcción para reparar su kiosco, leña, una motosierra y un lavamanos.
El sueño de Adriana es mudarse a una casa nueva, en la cuál pueda instalar el kiosco que se encuentra en reparaciones. Es por esto su motivación de continuar en el negocio, para concretar sus proyectos a fines del año 2012. Además sus hijas entrarán a la universidad y Adriana deberá costear sus estudios, para así brindarles un mejor bienestar.
Para Adriana el préstamo de Fondo esperanza ha significado un gran apoyo para su negocio, puesto que con éste, invertirá y obtendrá mayores ingresos. Respecto a las reuniones grupales, ella se siente muy a gusto con sus compañeras y asesora. Ya que existe mucha confianza y gentileza entre ellas. Por otro lado las capacitaciones han sido de gran utilidad para su negocio, ya que ha aprendido a registrar sus ingresos y salidas de dinero, con esto ha organizado mejor su negocio.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the “Nuestros Inicios” (Our Beginnings) community bank which is located in the city of Temuco.

Adriana is a saleswoman.  She sells 'sopaipillas' (a fried pastry), empanadas, 'completos' (sandwiches), jams, cakes and comfits that she makes herself.  However, the kiosk where she sells her products is currently being fixed because it is in a bad state of repair.  In the meanwhile, she continues making sales but she sells firewood as well as chocolates, jams, cakes and cookies that she makes herself.  Adriana's husband and daughter help her in her business since they both sell her products at work.  Adriana herself sells light lunches and breakfasts that her customers request directly from her home.

Adriana usually buys her merchandise in supermarkets.  This is how she stocks up with ingredients for making her products.  She buys her firewood from private homes.  Adriana will use her loan to buy building supplies to repair her kiosk.  She will also buy firewood, a chainsaw and a sink.  Adriana's dream is to move to a new home in which she can set up her kiosk.  Her motivation to continue in her business is to carry out her plans at the end of 2012.  Her daughters will start university and Adriana will pay for their studies in order to improve their well-being.

Fondo Esperanza's loan has represented a great support for Adriana's business since she will invest it and make more income.  As regards her group meetings, she feels very comfortable with her fellow group members and her advisor since they are very trusting and kind.  The training sessions have been very useful for her business since she has learned how to keep a record of her incomings and outgoings.  This has helped her to better organize her business.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  On the outskirts of the city are a series of spas and lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarica) and very striking flora and fauna concentrated in nearby nature parks.  This region is home to 50% of the Mapuches (indigenous people) in our country.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her kiosk and to buy firewood, a chainsaw and a sink

loans.name: Tututepec San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Grupo Tutepec San Pedro se llama así porque al lugar donde pertenecen se llama Tututepec y San Pedro por que es el patrón del pueblo. Este grupo pertenece a Villa de Tututepec que significa “Cerro del Pájaro”.
Este grupo tiene una  representante que se llama Alma Eva M. García de 35 años de edad quien vive en unión libre con el señor Jorge Luis Cerrano Cruz, tiene 3 hijos, ella es estilista tiene una estética, solicitó el préstamo para poder comprar artículos de belleza para su estética como son tintes, decolorante, tubos, cremas, entre otros productos.
Otra de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Alejandrina López M. de 53 años de edad esta casada con el señor Fernando Díaz Nicolás quien se dedica ala campo. Alejandrina se dedica  a la elaboración de tortillas hechas a mano, tamales, elotes, papaya, sandia, ejotes y jicama. Ella junto con su marido desde que viven juntos se han dedicado al campo a cosechar diferentes productos como: maíz, ejotes, calabaza, sandia, jicama de estos productos el 35% lo venden y el resto lo utilizan para consumo. Del maíz utilizan el maíz y el totomoztle para elaborar el tamal. Todos sus productos los vende en su casa por medio de un cartel que pone en la entrada de su casa y a través de una bocina que anuncia los productos.
Estas actividades han ayudado mucho a su familia ya que con ello pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, darles una educación y comida. Alejandrina comenta que a pesar de que cosecha varias cosas no obtiene muchas ganancias por que hay ocasiones que la plaga acaba un poco con ellos o en las épocas que llueve mucho de igual manera se daña y con lo que le queda pues lo utilizan para comer.
Ella comenta que actualmente le va bien con sus ventas y ha tenido que comprar algunas cosas para comprar sus productos, es por ello que solicito el préstamo para poder comprar insumos para la elaboración de tortillas y tamales, como son: cal, comal, leño, manteca, chile, cebolla carne de cerdo, carne de pollo. 
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Cristina X Ramírez: De 49 años de edad se dedica a la compra de hilos para la elaboración de servilletas para la venta.
Claudina M. X: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes, pollos, pan y tortillas para la venta.
Isabel E. López: De 62 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de atole para la venta.
Lorenza García E.: De 44 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de tortillas para la venta.
Enma Margarita López A.: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra de calzado colchas y perfumes para la venta.
Alma Eva M. Gracia: De 35 años de edad se dedica a la compra de artículos de belleza para su estética.
Alejandrina López M.: De 53 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas y tamales para la venta.
Francisca Aragón Hernández: De 66 años de edad se dedica a la compra de maíz e insumos  para la elaboración de tortilla y tamales para la venta.
Eva García Pérez: De 67 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes y compra de insumos para la elaboración de tortilla y tamales para la venta.
Ciria E. Juárez: De 51 años de edad se dedica a la compra de res, cerdo y pollos para la venta de carne.
Rosario S. Ríos: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollos para la venta.
texts.en:
The Tututepec San Pedro group is named after the town's patron saint and is located in Tututepec village, which means "Bird Hill". This group is represented by Cerrano Cruz, she has three children and works as an aesthetician. She is requesting this loan to buy beauty products for her salon such as hair dyes, bleaching dyes, curlers, and moisturizing creams, among other products. 

Other group members include Alejandrina López M., who is 53 years old and married to Fernando Díaz Nicolás, who is a farmer. Alejandrina prepares homemade tortillas, tamales, sweet corn, squash, watermelon, and jicama. She sells about a third of what she prepares, and keeps the rest for her family's consumption. Alejandrina uses the maize and dried maize leaves (totomoztle) to make tamales. She sells all her products from a cart in front of her home and advertises her products through a car-mounted loudspeaker.   

This work has helped her family a lot, as she is able to feed and provide education for her children. Alejandrina says that despite farming many crops, she doesn't earn much from the harvest due to crop pests or too much rain. The family also consumes much of what is produced on the farm. Currently, Alejandrina's sales are good and she needs to buy some ingredients to continue making her food products. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making tortillas and tamales, such as whitewash (to coat the inside of the wood-burning oven), a tortilla pan, firewood, lard, chilies, onions, pork and chicken.

The following individuals are group members:
Cristina X Ramírez: Age 49, needs to purchase thread to embroider napkins that she sells.
Claudina M. X: Age 39, needs to buy groceries, chicken, bread and tortillas for sale.
Isabel E. López: Age 62, needs to buy ingredients for making atole (hot maize drink).
Lorenza García E.: Age 44, needs to buy ingredients for making tortillas.
Enma Margarita López A.: Age 39, needs to buy footwear, bedding, and perfumes.
Alma Eva M. Gracia: Age 35, needs to purchase beauty products for her salon.
Alejandrina López M.: Age 53, needs to buy supplies to make tortillas and tamales that she sells.
Francisca Aragón Hernández: Age 66, needs to purchase maize and ingredients to make tortillas and tamales.
Eva García Pérez: Age 67, needs to buy groceries and ingredients to make tortillas and tamales.
Ciria E. Juárez: Age 51, needs to purchase beef, pork and poultry for butchery.
Rosario S. Ríos: Age 39, needs to purchase chicken for sale.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for salon.

location.town: Villa de Melchor Ocampo, Tututepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Machak Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MACHAK SARTAWI” iniciará el primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza de la señora Jenny.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de productos AVON, venta de bañadores, venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de pollos a la brostes, iniciación de salón de peinados, venta de api, venta de anticucho.
 
La señora Jenny tiene como negocio la venta de verduras, que compra en la ceja, de la ciudad de El Alto. Con el crédito que sacará comprará mas mercadería, los que venderá los días jueves y domingo en la feria 16 de julio. 

En la actualidad la señora tiene veinte y tres años, es soltera y el negocio lo realiza sola. Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que recién ingreso  ala institución.
texts.en:
The “MACHAK SARTAWI” community bank is beginning its first loan cycle as part of the Panamericana regional office.  This group has nine members.  The bank is managed by a board of directors which is headed by Jenny.  The businesses that the group's members carry out include: knitting blankets, selling Avon products, selling swimsuits, selling vegetables, selling fruit, selling fried chicken, setting up a hairdressing salon, selling 'api' (a thick purple corn drink), selling kebabs, etc.

Jenny's business is selling vegetables that she buys in La Ceja, in the city of El Alto.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise that she will sell on Thursdays and Sundays in the 16 de Julio market.

Jenny is 23 years old, single, and carries out her business on her own.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she only recently joined the institution.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
HaiD. is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

HaiD.’s group is located in the urban slums north of Santo Domingo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her two little children.

HaiD. is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling silver jewelry in her community by purchasing rings, chain, bracelets, and many other accessories.

HaiD. will use the profits to invest in new items and increase her inventory. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry

loans.name: Blanca Sofia

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo, está rodeada por maravillosas playas de clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, ella tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un niño de un año de edad. Su esposo trabaja con su familia en un restaurante / hostería.

Ella al igual que su esposo se dedica a trabajar en el negocio de la familia, ellos tienen un restaurante / hostería muy conocido en la ciudad que se llama “La Quinta San Juan”, allí ella al igual que todos los miembros de la familia trabajan todos los días tanto en el restaurante como en la hostería, nos cuenta que la familia de su esposo tiene este negocio por más de 30 años y que él desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en el mismo.

Este crédito es para adecuar un salón de eventos. Está en el Banco Comunal por cuatro años y le gusta por la forma de trabajar de la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener su negocio propio, aparte del de la familia de su esposo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the '8 de Mayo' community bank meets in the beautiful city of Portoviejo which is surrounded by marvelous beaches that enjoy warm and pleasant weather.  The city is home to beautiful and tenacious women.

Here we meet 30 year-old Blanca who is married and has a one-year-old son.  Her husband works with his family in a restaurant / small hotel.

Blanca works with her husband in the family business.  They own a very well-known restaurant / small hotel in the city which is called "La Quinta San Juan".  Blanca works there together with other family members every day, both in the restaurant and in the hotel.  She tells us that her husband's family has owned this business for more than 30 years and that he started working there at a very young age.

Blanca will use this loan to fit out a multi-purpose room.  She has been a member of her community bank for four years and likes it because of the way it works.  Blanca's dream is to own her own business apart from that of her husband's family.

loans.use: to fit out a multi-purpose room

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino, es natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, tiene 34 años de edad, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, convive con Marisol Navarro de 25 años y fruto de esa relación hoy tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en una casa alquilada en la jurisdicción de Santa Rosa, pero a su vez cuentan con vivienda  propia situado en la comunidad de Anteccasa anexo del distrito de Santa Rosa. Marcelino, empezó su aventura como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro lo llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 17 años de manera independiente; en el cual viene cultivando  plantas de café, hojas de coca y plantaciones de café; en total posee 05 hectáreas y media de terreno. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido. Asimismo nos menciona que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias, impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando sus plantaciones. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un vehiculo moto carguero, que le servirá como utilidad de transporte para así trasladar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es repoblar sus cultivos que quedaron dañados con las lluvias intermitentes propias de la naturaleza. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. A la vez se siente muy contento con la institución por  proporcionarle el crédito. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un moto carguero lo cual le servirá como medio de transporte para trasladar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio.
texts.en: Marcelino, 34,  is a native of the Santa Rosa district.  He is a cheerful and hardworking man who lives with Marisol Navarro, 25, and their 3 children.  They all live together in a rented home in the jurisdiction of Santa Rosa, but they also own a home in the community of Anteccasa, an annex of the Santa Rosa district.  Marcelino started his business as a farmer when he was very young, working his parent's land.  His passion for agriculture led him to acquire his own land that he has been working independently for 17 years, cultivating coffee and coca leaves.  In all, he has 5 and a half hectares of land.  At harvest time he hires workers who help him to harvest the products more quickly, so that he can achieve faster progress with his work.  He is very dedicated to his job, because thanks to his daily efforts he is able to see his plants bear fruit and obtain good profits from every kilogram of product that he sells.  He asserts that he does not like the winter because during these months the insects are abundant and this negatively affects his crop yields.  The loan that he is applying for will be used to buy a cargo motorcycle to quickly deliver his products to the collection centers. But now, his priority is to replant his cultivations that were damaged with the intermittent rains.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he is ready to make all of his payments on time, since he wants to be able to access credit in the future.  He also feels very pleased that the institution is providing him with this loan.  With the 3,000 Peruvian soles requested, he will buy a cargo motorcycle that will he will use to transport his products from the farm to the collection centers.

loans.use: to buy a cargo motorcycle to transport his products.

loans.name: Trabajando Por Fe Group

texts.en:
Orfa Dalila is 38 years old, married, and has four children. All of her children are currently in school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and helps support the family. Orfa sells general goods near her neighborhood school and has been doing so for the past three years. 

As part of the ¨Trabajando por Fe¨ group, Orfa is requesting a loan to purchase more products to sell in her store. She would like to purchase a variety of school supplies since most of her customers are the students and parents of a nearby school. The other members of the group are involved in the following business activities: vegetable sales, dressmaking and sales, and general goods sales.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Josefa Ortiz Tetepec Group

texts.es:
El grupo Josefa Ortiz Tetepec llamado así porque las personas que la integran son vecinas de la colonia Josefa Ortiz  y Tetepec porque así se llama su población, esta integrado por 10 personas muy trabajadoras que luchan DIA a di para tener una mejor vida. 
Carmelita Pérez Nicolás de 36 años de edad es la representante del grupo, es madre soltera, una mujer muy admirable que siempre a luchado y trabajado para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, la hija mayor esta estudiando la universidad y los dos mas pequeños estudian la primaria. Carmelita tiene una tienda de Abarrotes y Perfumería, que se llama URI-MAURI llamado así porque sus dos pequeños hijos Uriel y Mauricio. Ella tiene esta tienda desde hace 19 años desde que nació su primera hija, inicio con este negocio debido a la necesidad que tenia para mantener a su pequeña. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar mas productos  como: arroz, azúcar, café, jabón entre otros  ya que últimamente había tenido  ventas muy bajas y no le alcanzaba el dinero para surtir su tienda, de las ganancias que obtiene es para mantener a sus hijos.
Otra de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Martha Norma Vázquez S. de 35 años de edad quien esta casada con el señor Antelmo Quiroz Quiroz quien es campesino, tiene 4 hijos 2 mujeres y 2 hombres de las respectivas edades: 20, 17, 12 y 11 años.
Martha se dedica  a la elaboración de pan, para que ella pueda vender sus productos  tiene que ir  a ofrecerlos de casa en casa, ha tenido buenas ventas y por lo tanto tiene buenas ganancias, ya que en la colonia por donde vive es la única que hace pan, además de sus panes son muy deliciosos y existe variedad en sus productos. Ella inicio este negocio debido a la necesidad que existía en su asa porque no alcanzaba el dinero que aportaba su esposo y como sus hijos estudian, necesitaba más dinero.
Ella comenta que al inicio solo elaboraba 50 panes  pero con el transcurso del tiempo ah ido incrementando sus ventas, es por ello que solicito el préstamo para comprar más insumos y hacer más panes.
Martha comenta que su meta es llegar a poner una panadería en su población y axial poder generar empleo a la gente de su comunidad.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Claudina C. R.: De 27 años de edad se dedica a la compra de plásticos para la venta.
Amada Yudiht Hernández Díaz: De 40 años de edad se dedica a la compra de dulces para la venta.
Martha Norma Vázquez S.: De 35 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan para la venta.
Juanita Nicolás S.: De 33 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes para la venta.
Cita T. S.: De 36 años de edad se dedica a la compra de calzado y ropa para la venta.
Faustina Nicolás Martínez: De 31 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
Azucena M. E.: De 34 años de edad se dedica a la compra de medicamentos para la venta.
Carmelita Pérez Nicolás: De 36 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes para la venta.
Yolanda A. Hernández: De 21 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa para la venta.
Jerónimo V. C.: De 71 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ganado vacuno para la venta.
texts.en:
This group is called "Josefa Ortiz Tetepec" because the members are residents of the Josefa Ortiz and Tetepec neighborhoods.  The group has 10 hardworking members who struggle each day to have a better life.  

Carmelita Pérez Nicolás, 36, is the representative of the group.  She is a single mother who is admirable because she has worked hard and fought to provide for her 3 children.  Her oldest daughter is studying at the university and the two younger children are in elementary school.  Carmelita has a store where she sells groceries and perfumes which is called "URI-MAURI" because her two small children are named Uriel and Mauricio.  She has had this store for 19 years, ever since the birth of her oldest daughter.  She started the business because she needed to support her small daughter.  She is requesting a loan to buy products such as: rice, sugar, coffee, soap and other items because recently her sales have been very low and she does not have enough money to stock her store.  She uses the earnings from the store to support her children.  

Another member of the group is Martha Norma Vázquez S., 35, who is married to  Antelmo Quiroz Quiroz, a farmer. They have 4 children: 2 girls and 2 boys aged 20, 17, 12 and 11.  Martha has a business making bread, which she sells door-to-door.  She has had good sales and good earnings, since she has the only business in the neighborhood that sells bread.  In addition, her bread is very delicious and she offers variety in her products.  She started this business because her husband's income was not sufficient to cover the family's expenses, and because they needed more money to pay for their children's education.  She comments that at the start she only made 50 loaves of bread, but over time she has been increasing her sales.  For this reason she is requesting a loan so that she can buy more supplies and make more bread.  Martha says that her goal is to eventually have a bakery in her town, so that she could provide employment for some people in her community.

The members of the group are the following:
Claudina C. R., 27, who sells plastic products.
Amada Yudiht Hernández Díaz, 40, who sells sweets. 
Martha Norma Vázquez S., 35, who makes bread to sell. 
Juanita Nicolás S., 33, who has a grocery store.
Cita T. S., 36, who sells clothing and shoes.
Faustina Nicolás Martínez, 31, who makes and sells tamales.
Azucena M. E., 34, who sells medicines.
Carmelita Pérez Nicolás, 36, who sells groceries. 
Yolanda A. Hernández, 21, who sells clothing.
Jerónimo V. C., 71 , who raises livestock.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 26 años; vive en concubinato con Erminio. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Braham y Verenise; a los que cuidan y alimentan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Su actividad económica es la agricultura. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia en la siembra de arveja, habas, papa y maíz; los cuales se sitúan en el caserío de San Antonio, donde todas las mañanas sube muy contenta a cuidar de sus cultivos, con la ayuda de su esposo y de peones que le ayudan en tiempos de cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas donde los sembríos ya se encuentran maduros, púes ve concretado su esfuerzo en la venta de sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Su principal dificultad son los gastos que realiza en la educación de sus hijos; por ello se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza en el banquito comunal. Que le ayuda en la inversión y mejora de sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente satisfecha por el cargo de tesorera que ejerce. Después de su cosecha de papa y maíz está pensando sembrar arveja. Por ello con el crédito comprará 2 bolsas de semillas de arveja para comenzar su siembra.
texts.en: Luzmila is 26 years old. She lives with her partner Erminio. They have two children together: Braham and Verenise. They take care of the children and feed them in their own house located in the village of Bellavista Huaracayo. Luzmila works in agriculture. She now has seven years of experience farming peas, beans, potatoes and corn. The fields are located in the village of San Antonio. Every morning she is very happy to take of her crops. Her husband and other laborers help her during harvests times. What she likes most about her work are the periods of time when crops are ripe. Then she can actually see her efforts by selling her crops in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her main difficulties are the expenses of her children's education. For this reason, Luzmila is happy about working with the communal bank. The bank helps with investments and improving her crops. She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank. This is her second loan with MFP and she is satisfied with the position as treasurer. After the potato and corn harvests, she is thinking about planting peas. With this credit, she will buy two bags of pea seeds to start planting.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds

loans.name: 16 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “16 DE MARZO” iniciará el primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza de la señora Victoria.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carpintería, tienda de abarrotes, venta de api, venta de repuestos de autos, venta de termos y biberones, venta de carne, tejidos de bayetas.
 
La señora Victoria tiene como negocio la venta autos y repuestos usados, que compra en Santa Cruz o en Cochabamba; con el crédito que sacará comprará chatarras y repuestos, los que venderá los días jueves y domingo en la feria 16 de julio y los martes y viernes en el sajra katu. 

En la actualidad la señora tiene cuarenta y cinco años, es casada y tiene un niño, ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo realiza conjuntamente su esposo. 

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, las capacitaciones, ya que esto le despeja.
texts.en:
The communal bank “16 de marzo” (March 16th) will begin its first cycle in the Centro Focal de Panamericana (Panamerican office).  It is made up of 8 members and is run by a board with Victoria at its head.  The members have different types of business including: carpentry, general stores, sales of api (a traditional Bolivian drink), car parts, thermoses, baby bottles, meat, and woven wool. 

Victoria’s business is selling cars and used parts that she buys in Santa Cruz or Cochabamba.  With the loan she will buy scrap metal and parts that she will sell on Thursdays and Sundays in the 16th of July market, and Tuesdays and Fridays in the Sajra Katu market.
She is forty five, married and has a son.  She has this business together with her husband.

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she tells us it’s the savings and the training that she has really helped her.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal and parts for cars

loans.name: Ruben
