loans.use: to buy raw materials, supplies and fresh fruit, and also to make some structural improvements to her premises

loans.name: Mercedes Moserrate

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Creciendo Para El Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el sector conocido como Parque Forestal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce porque en él hay un bello parque, además por su exuberante vegetación y por sus bellos paisajes.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco comunal 10 años, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta porque se divierte en las reuniones. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijas las cuales ya son mayores de edad, sus hijas viven en casa de su suegra. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo, el mismo que tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz, nos cuenta que su esposo se especializa en maquinarias pesadas por lo cual es muy común que algunas veces se desplace a otros lugares donde están las maquinas dañadas para darles mantenimiento, él trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Nos cuenta que desde pequeño él aprendió esta actividad y que antes trabajaba con su papá pero que hace 10 años se independizo.

Este crédito es para comprar ciertas piezas y repuestos para su trabajo.

Su sueño es tener su casa bien acabada.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Creciendo para el Futuro' (Growing for the Future) community bank meets in a sector known as 'Parque Forestal', in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its beautiful park and also for its lush vegetation and beautiful landscape.

Mercedes is a founding member of her community bank.  She has been a member for 10 years and is the bank's treasurer.  She likes being a member because she enjoys herself at the meetings.  Mercedes is 47 years old, married, and has three grown-up daughters.  Her daughters live in her mother-in-law's house.  Mercedes' husband is a car mechanic.

Mercedes is a good housewife who is taking this loan for her husband's business.  Her husband has a garage.  She tells us that her husband specializes in heavy machinery so he often has to travel to other places where the damaged machines are in order to repair them.  He works every day from 8.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until even later.  Mercedes tells us that he learned his trade when he was very young.  He used to work with his dad but he started working for himself 10 years ago.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy certain pieces and spare parts for her husband's work.  Her dream is to have her house nicely finished.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ermis Del Carmen

texts.es: Ermis del Carmen A. vive en Soledad y es la propietaria del negocio “ Servivio de Peluquerìa Los Angeles” actividad a la que dedicò depues de aprenderla, por la necesidad de aportar ingresos a su hogar para apoyar la gestiòn de  su conyuge en beneficio de su familia en la cual existen 3 hijos en las edades de 8, 12 y 14 años. Ermis aprovechando su trabajo comunitario decidiò dedicarse a este emprendimiento pues no encontraba fuentes de empleo empresarial, pero ahora se siente muy contenta porque ha logrado con su autonomia generar ingresos para su familia y estar mas cerca de ellos. Ahora su sueño se concentra en terminar de construìr su vivienda apoyar una educaciòn de caliad para sus hijos y sobre todo hacer crecer su negocio para lograrlo. Con su credikiva que es su tercer crédito con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que està vinculada hace dos años, comprarà  champoo, ganchos, pinta uñas, limas y todo lo que requiere para realzar la belleza de sus clientes y continuar vendindoles imagen personal y profesional de acuerdo a su personalidad.
texts.en:
Ermis del Carmen A. lives in Soledad and is the owner of a hairdressing business called 'Servicio de Peluquería Los Angeles'.  She has been in her business since she learned the trade as she needed to make income for her household in order to support her husband and three children aged 8, 12 and 14.  Taking advantage of her community work, Ermis decided to undertake this venture as she wasn't able to find any other sources of work.  However, now she feels very happy because, through her independence, she has managed to make income for her family and also be closer to them.  Now her dreams are to finish building her home, to provide her children with a good-quality education and, above all, to grow her business in order to achieve this.

Ermis' Kiva loan is her third with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that she has been a client of for two years.  She will use her loan to buy shampoo, hairpins, nail polish, nail files and everything else she needs to highlight the beauty of her customers and continue selling them a personal and professional image to fit their personality.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hairpins, nail polish and nail files

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos Arturo  y su esposa tienen un taller de confecciones hace 30 años y aunque fabrican todo tipo de prendas de vestir su especialidad es la linea femenina,  porque allì esta concentrado su mayor mercado. Entre èl y su esposa han distribuìdo el trabajo, mientras Carlos Arturo se encarga de las compras de materias primas e insumos, de la definicion de los precios de venta y la negociación de sus productos en el mercado, su esposa esta dedicada totalmente a la producciòn, arte que aprendiò por  tradicion familiar y con la cual se ha identificado esta pareja, concentrando sus utilidades en lograr que sus tres hijos, que ahora estan en las edades de 35 a 40 años, sean profesionales. Su meta mas adelante es contratar una operaria para aumentar la producciòn, la venta y las utilidades , pues la competencia es fuerte especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con la ropa importada y ellos deben dedicar mas tiempo a aumentar sus posibilidades productivas, aunque en el momento  la afrontan produciendo uno a uno y respondiendo a cada cliente de acuerdo con sus condiciones personales y a la personalidad que desea proyectar. Con su credikiva que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo,  lograrà comprar  telas botones accesorios en mayor cantidad, porque esta preparando nuevos diseños que ya tiene encargados por sus buenos clientes y con ello garantiza  su éxito en las ventas
texts.en:
Carlos Arturo and his wife have owned a dressmaking workshop for 30 years.  Although they make all kinds of clothes, their speciality is women's clothes because that is their biggest market.  Carlos Arturo and his wife share the work between them.  While he is in charge of buying raw materials and supplies, setting sales prices and negotiating their products in the market, his wife works exclusively on the production side of things.

Carlos' wife learned her art by family tradition and the couple have become identified with it.  They used the profits that they made in their business to ensure that their children, who are now between the ages of 35 and 40, became professionals.  Their future goal is to hire a worker to increase their production, sales and profits as competition is strong, especially as regards imported clothes.  As a result, they must spend more time increasing their production possibilities.  However, right now they face their competition by producing their products one by one and responding to each customer in accordance with their personal situation and the personality that they want to project.

This Kiva loan is Carlos' first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy fabric, buttons and accessories in larger quantities because they are preparing new designs and already have orders for them from their good customers.  This will guarantee that their sales are successful.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons and accessories in larger quantities

loans.name: Llina Paola

texts.es: LLina Paola Gòmez se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, con grandes satisfacciones y es la ver como sus clientes, cuentan los testimonios del efecto de sus productos en la salud de ellos . Llina es una mujer casada y con dos hijos en las edades de 4 a 8 años, que iniciò esta actividad cuando su esposo fuè trasladado a otra ciudad y decidiò empezar a generar oportunidades para ella y para su familia, así fue como empezó, le fue bien y le gustó, pero cuando llegó el nacimiento de su tercer hijo suspendió su negocio, para dedicarse a su atenciòn y la de sus otros dos pequeños y una vez su esposo fue nuevamente trasladado a la ciudad e Barranquilla,   la retomó con mas fuerza y hoy se siente muy satisfecha de haber logado su autonomia y sobre todo de apoyar a sus esposo en la prosperidad de su hogar. Asì es como Llina Paola tiene sus principales clientes en San Andrès, isla donde naciò  y tambien en Valledupar, Sincelejos y Cartagena, estas tres ùltimas son ciudades de la costa Norte de Colombia.  Para desarrollar esta actividad Llina  se ha preparado mucho, pues es necesario conocer la composiciòn de los productos, sus efectos y sobre todo hacer seguimiento al impacto que estos producen en sus clientes. Su dinamismo, diciplina y concentraciòn en su meta  le facilitado el trascender de un mercado domèstico e informal, donde solo concentraba familiares y vecinos,  a un mercado mas activo  extendido en otras ciudades de una manera mas formal, mientras  Llina continua con su sueño de perfeccionarlo  y tener un punto de distribuciòn en los Centros comerciales, para lograr un acceso masivo de clientes, aunque su gran desafio es conseguir el capital para hacerlo; pero para Llina teniendo un norte muy claro es muy probable que logre cristalizar sus objetivas aspiraciones.
texts.en:
Llina Paola Gòmez sells natural medicines.  She finds her work very satisfying and enjoys it when her customers tell her about the effect her products have had on their health.  Llina is married and has two children aged 4 and 8.  She started out in this business when her husband was transferred to another city and she decided to start creating opportunities for herself and her family.  Her business went well and she enjoyed it but then, when her third child was born, she put her business on hold so that she could devote her time to him and her other two young children.  When her husband was transferred again to the city of Barranquilla, she started her business again with even more energy and today she feels very satisfied to have achieved her independence and to have become able to support her husband in making their household prosper.

Llina Paola's main customers are in San Andrés, the island where she was born, and also in Valledupar, Sincelejos and Cartagena.  These last three places are cities on the north coast of Colombia.  In order to carry out her business, Llina did a lot of preparation work since it is necessary to know the make-up of her products, their effects and, above all, to keep track of the impact that they have on her customers.  Llina's dynamism, discipline and concentration on her goal enabled her to move from supplying a domestic and informal market where she only sold to family members and neighbors, to selling products to a more active market which extends to other cities, in a more formal way.  Llina dreams of perfecting her business and owning a sales location in shopping malls, so that she can have access to more customers.  Her biggest challenge is acquiring the capital to do this but Llina knows very clearly what she wants and so it is very probable that she will manage to achieve her aspirations.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines

loans.name: Elvia María Del Rosario

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Creciendo Para El Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el sector conocido como Parque Forestal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce porque en él hay un bello parque, además por su exuberante vegetación y por sus bellos paisajes.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Elvia, ella  tiene 45 años  de edad y es madre soltera de  tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y una jovencita de 13 años, dos de sus hijos viven con ella uno estudia en universidad y la menor en colegio. Lleva en el Banco Comunal dos años y le gusta el grupo de compañeras.

Tiene un pequeño restaurante donde prepara comida, bocadillos y otros productos elaborados. Trabaja todas las tardes desde  las 17h00  hasta las 22h00, solo vende meriendas ya que le deja mejores ganancias y también aprovecha que su hija le puede ayudar a esa hora ya que ella estudia de mañana. Nos cuenta que lleva 4 años con su negocio y que le va muy bien, esta muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que le han dado.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es darles una muy buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Creciendo para el Futuro' (Growing for the Future) community bank meets in a sector known as 'Parque Forestal', in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its beautiful park and also for its lush vegetation and beautiful landscape. 

Here we meet Elvia who is 45 years old and a single mother with three children.  Two of her children are already grown up and she also has a 13 year-old daughter.  Two of her children live with her.  One is studying at university and the youngest is in school.  Elvia has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes her fellow group members.

Elvia has a small restaurant where she prepares meals, sandwiches and other products.  She works every evening from 5.00pm to 10.00pm.  She only sells evening meals since they make her the best profits.  She also takes advantage of the fact that her daughter can help her at this time of day since she studies in the morning.  Elvia tells us that she has been in her business for 4 years.  It is doing very well and she is very grateful to Fundación Espoir for the help that they have given her.

Elvia will use this loan to buy products for making her meals.  Her dream is to provide her daughters with a very good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing meals

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Creciendo Para El Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el sector conocido como Parque Forestal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce porque en él hay un bello parque, además por su exuberante vegetación y por sus bellos paisajes.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Benedicta, ella tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 8 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y solo el menor de sus hijos vive con ella. Su esposo es maestro albañil.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveres de consumo en su casa, allí vende de todo un poco desde  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes hasta embutidos y carnes, nos cuenta que poco a poco con los créditos cada vez surte más su tiendita. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local. Nos comenta que lleva cinco años en su negocio y que en él se entretiene mucho.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres  años y le gusta porque le ha sacado de muchos apuros.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y que su tienda sea la mejor de su localidad.
texts.en:
The “Creciendo Para El Futuro” (Growing For The Futre) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the sector known as Parque Forestal in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for its beautiful park, its exuberant vegetation, and its beautiful scenery.

We meet Benedicta here.  She is 57 years old, married, and has eight children.  All of her children are adults, and only the youngest lives with her.  Her husband is a master bricklayer.

She has a small grocery store in her house.  She sells a little of everything from rice, sugar, oil, and detergent to sausages and meat.  She tells us that with each loan she, little by little, stocks her little store more.  She works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  She buys products in the Portoviejo center, although she receives most of the products at her store.  She tells us that she has had her business for five years, and it keeps her very busy.

She will use the loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other basic needs items.  She has been in the communal bank for three years.  She likes it because it has relieved her of many hardships. 

Her goals are to get ahead and for her store to be the best in her area.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other basic needs items

loans.name: Maria Evelyn

texts.en:
Maria Evelyn R. is from the village of Western Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old. Maria Evelyn is a widow and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling coffee, soaps, candies and snack foods in the local community. She also deals in selling AVON products. Maria Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Maria Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like soaps, canned goods and beverages. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like soaps, canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace S. is from the village of Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Mary Grace is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of her service. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

location.town: Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

Lourdes owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling vegetables like squash and Chinese pechay (cabbage) and also selling spices and food seasonings in the local community. Ma. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ma. Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Lourdes is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables like eggplant and carrots. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan, North Cotabato. She is 39 years old. Grace is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and beverages in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Karen Michelle

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Creciendo Para El Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el sector conocido como Parque Forestal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce porque en él hay un bello parque, además por su exuberante vegetación y por sus bellos paisajes.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karen, tiene 19 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad. El marido es chofer de taxi.

Ella tiene una mini tienda de viveres de consumo en su casa, allí además de vender productos de primera necesidad también vende helados y recargas telefónicas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo. Nos cuenta que recién su negocio tiene un año pero que ha ganado mucha clientela por que tiene de todo un poco para que sus clientes estén contentos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, helados,  recargas telefónicas entre otros productos. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta ya que con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que le ha permitido ganarse la vida.

Su meta es terminar sus estudios ya que tuvo que dejar porque sus hijos están muy pequeños.
texts.en:
The “Creciendo Pare El Futuro” (Growing For The Futre) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the sector known as Parque Forestal in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for its beautiful park, its exuberant vegetation, and its beautiful scenery.

We meet Karen here.  She is 19 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has two children, ages three and one.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

She has a mini grocery store in her house.  In addition to selling basic needs products, she also sell ice cream and mobile phone recharge cards.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., and sometimes she works later.  She buys the products in the center of Portoviejo.

She tells us that she has had her business for a year.  She has gotten many customers because she has a little of everything so that her customers will be happy.

She will use this loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, ice cream, and phone recharge cards, among other products.  This is her third cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because she started her business with her first loan, and this has allowed her to earn a living.

Her goal is to finish her studies, which she had to leave because her children are so young.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, ice cream, and phone recharge cards, among other products

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester C. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 34 years old. Ester is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of selling ready to wear clothing, sandals and shoe products in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina es una joven de 28 años de edad, cuenta con el apoyo economico de su compañero de vida  que se encuentra trabajando en Costa Rica el cual le manda mensualmente para los gastos familiares, ella tiene 6  años de trabajar como docente de primaria en la Escuela Rafael Salmeròn en la colonia Talolinga  repartiendo el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de su colonia, es bien recomendada por vecinos y amigos ha luchado para llegar a obtener sus propios bienes, esta muy agradecida con el apoyo recibido de fondo Kiva ya que logro realizar su habitacion.  Solicita su quinto  crèdito para construir un porche en su vivienda y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar y darle mas valor a su propiedad.  Dina sueña con seguir sus estudios universitarios y que su familia goce de mucha salud.
texts.en:
Dina, 28, has economic support from her life partner who is working in Costa Rica and sends her money monthly for family expenses.  She’s been working as an Elementary School Teacher at Rafael Salmerón School in Talolinga neighborhood for six years.  She teaches peasant children from her neighborhood.  

She is well recommended by neighbors and friends because she’s struggled to obtain her own assets.  She is very grateful for the support she’s gotten from Kiva which made it possible for her to build her house.

She is asking for her fifth loan to build a porch on the house in order to have better living conditions and improve her property’s value.  Dina dreams with continuing her university education and that her family enjoys much good health.

loans.use: to build a porch.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo de 30 años de edad, labora como extencionista del INTA  desde hace 11 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad, segun referencias comerciales  y personales este joven es muy emprendedor que ha luchado para que a su familia no le falte nada ya que son una familia bien unida y humilde. 

Solicita su octavo crédito para comprar un solar que se lo venden faborable y no cuenta con suficiente fondo para comprarlo de sus propios ingresos por lo que solicita el apoyo de Kiva en este financiamento,  

su sueño es construir su propio hogar y gozar de estabilida laboral.
texts.en:
Aldo is 30 years old and has been working as an agricultural engineer for INTA for 11 years.  He carries out his job with great responsibility and honesty according to his work and personal references.  This young man is very enterprising and he has worked hard so that his family doesn't want for anything as they are a very united and humble family.

Aldo is requesting his eighth loan to buy a plot of land that he is being offered at a good price as he doesn't have enough money to buy it with his own income.  For this reason, he is requesting Kiva's support with this loan.  His dream is to build his own home and enjoy job stability.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Delmis Carolina

texts.es:
La profesora Delmis  Carolina de 30 años de edad,  trabaja como docente en la Escuela Rubèn   Dario  # 2 desde hace 7 años desempeñandose como maestra de primaria a niños campesinos de su comunidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su  compañero de vida que trabaja como agricultor en la parcelita que ellos poseen, ambos comparten sus gastos familiares. Delmis se caracteriza por ser una persona honrada, trabajadora, con buenas relaciones sociales y muy respetuosa, es seguidora de las cosas de Dios, profesa la religion Catolica.  

Solicita su cuarto credito para construir una habitaciòn, asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es gozar de estabilidad laboral y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Delmis Carolina, 30, has been working as a primary school teacher in the Rubèn Dario school for the past 7 years with the village children of her community.  She has a common-law-husband who is a farmer on the small lot that they own and both share the family expenses.  Delmis is a honorable, hard-working woman who has good social skills and is very respectful.  She is religious and a Catholic.
She is requesting a fourth loan to build a house so she can give her family a better life.  Her greatest dream is to enjoy steady work and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy property

loans.name: Nhoy

texts.en: Nhoy R. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. R. sells clothes and souvenirs to tourists, earning an income of $10 per day. Her husband sells palm sugar, earning an income of about $10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $50 on other necessary expenses. R. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more souvenirs to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be R.'s second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Sarn

texts.en:
Sarn D. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. 

D. is a housewife, while her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of US $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $75 on food and US $30 on other necessary expenses. 

D. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase more construction supplies for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies to improve the business

loans.name: Dom

texts.en: Dom P. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. P. produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning an income of $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $45 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be P.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen S., who is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples, sells fish, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 30 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more fish for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her store such as milk, yogurts, cereals & fruits among others

loans.name: Nhoung

texts.en:
Nhoung C., who is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples, sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 30 on other necessary expenses.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more construction materials to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Arn

texts.en: Arn S. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. sells groceries, earning an income of $5 per day. Her husband is employed at a tobacco company, earning an income of about $6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $75 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 32 years old and married with four children who are all in school. Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to fund her business operations.

Rebecca has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items. Rebecca also earns income with a ready to wear (clothing) business and food vending. 

In the future, Rebecca would like to send her kids to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Yeoun

texts.en:
Yeoun S. is married and resides with his family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. provides laundry services, earning an income of USD 3 per day, while his wife sells food, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to decorate his wife's food stand and repair the motorbike to transport food. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to decorate his wife's food stand and repair the motorbike

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en: Wennie is a married woman who lives in Toledo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Jose, who is 54 years old, works as a Brgy. Captain to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 25 and 27 years old. Wennie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wennie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to buy a stock of drinks, canned items and plain food items so that she can continue to save up for future education of her grandchildren. Wennie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like drinks, canned items and plain food items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor S. is married and resides with his family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day, while his wife sells vegetables, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to operate the business more efficiently

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a piggery. She lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her piggery business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Rizalina is borrowing PHP 21,000 to buy feed for her pigs. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rizalina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 49 years old and widowed with four children. With one child in school, Roselyn works very hard to provide for the family. Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Roselyn would like to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

She lives in the province of Negros Oriental, Philippines. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,600. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
From Phnom Penh city, Chao V. sells Khmer noodles to earn a daily income of around 3 USD per day. For many years she has sold Khmer noodles that she gets from her husband. They were married years ago. They have 6 children, one of whom is single, and the rest are married. One of Chao's children works in construction as a building worker, and he often shares his profit with her to help in the family’s needs. 

Chao V.'s house is getting old and it is hard for her and her family live in. She really wants to fix it, but her cash-on-hand is not enough to do so. That is why Chao V. would like to apply for a loan from Kiva to repair her old house. For future planning, the family wishes to enlarge their business, and expand their house.

loans.use: to repair her old house

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan C. is a 57-year-old, married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She and her husband cultivate rice crops on their own land. They have been spending most their lives in the farming business and they average 3 USD per day in profits from this occupation. In addition to farming, her husband also buys poles to make wooden beds to sell for additional income to support the whole family. They have 6 children; 4 are single and 2 are married. Three of the children are employed, earning profits in a variety of jobs. Tan C. would like to ask for a loan, to add with her savings, to hold a wedding party for her kid.

loans.use: to have a wedding party for her kid

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is a married woman who lives in Negros Occidental, Philippines.  She earns her living by buying and selling fruit/root crops and operating a livestock business. Her husband Romeo is 60 years old and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are 20 to 36 years old. Eliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000 to purchase fruit and root crops so that she could continue to save up for future family needs. Eliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and root crops

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Felipa has been in this business for five years. Felipa also earns income with a general store and food vending. 

In the future, Felipa would like to earn and save so that she could send her children to school.

With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Olivia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy feed, medicines and fishing gear so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Olivia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Naomi

With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Naomi has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy piglets so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and house repairs. Naomi is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Radhika M. T. is married and has three children aged 30, 24 and 19. In 1995, she established her business selling cow's milk. Working seven days a week and five hours each day, she supports her family. Radhika has already received and repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Radhika plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Aisalkyn's Group

texts.en:
Aisalkyn K. is 62 years old and a leader of this group. She is one of those early birds, who catch the worm before others do. In spite her age Aisalkyn still devotes much time and energy to her farming. Aisalkyn and her husband, a pensioner, live on their own while the youngest of their three children helps in the household. They live in Tup, a rural area that does not have any industry or trade potential. Instead, the major occupations for local residents are agriculture and cattle breeding. The farmers cultivate not only traditional vegetables, fruits, and grain crop, but also try to innovate new exotic types of agricultural products. Aisalkyn, along with other group members, is getting ready to begin spring fieldwork. She grows mainly vegetables in large amounts, because she was fortunate to acquire a large plot of land in 1996. Large profits are gained in fall, when the harvest is gathered. Her monthly income is 3,000 soms. Aisalkyn led this group in applying for this loan because she needs funds to purchase potato seeds for the upcoming season. 

        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Nasiba's Group

texts.en:
Nasiba S., a 38-year-old resident of the small town of Nookat, in Osh Province, Kyrgyzstan, is the leader of this group. She and her husband Kushbak have run a family business for 11 years buying, fattening and reselling cattle. The oldest of their four sons does his best to help his parents in this difficult work. Prior to starting the business, the family sold vegetables and fruits in a local bazaar, but due to declining profits they switched to cattle, a move that has made possible major repairs to the house. With a monthly income of about 6000 soms, Nasiba is requesting a loan to purchase additional heads of cattle. Her dream is to open a recreation spot and have many tourists visit.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy stock for her general store and also buy electronic load to resell so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. This will be his first loan fR. CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to carry recyclable materials

loans.name: Temirbek

texts.en:
Temirbek M. is 48 and married with seven children. He has worked as a veterinarian in his local are for a long time and has wide experience. In 1994, after the breakup of the Soviet Union, Temirbek decided to start his own cattle-breeding business. Starting with the sum of 40,000 KGS, he has expanded his livestock to twenty sheep, two cows, and one horse, from which he gets a monthly profit of 4,000 KGS.  Temirbek uses the revenue from his business to pay for the education of his elder children.
 
Temirbek has taken out two previous loans from Bai Tushum and Partners to develop and improve his farm. These loans were used as intended and repaid on time. With his third loan of 80,000 KGS Temirbek will purchase calves and bull calves. With the revenue from his loan he will rebuild and improve his cattle barn. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. It is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S., 59, lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She is a housewife and her husband makes a living by selling firewood. He earns about $6 a day, and the family spends $83 a month on food and $35 on other necessities. S. is applying for a loan of $600 to repair the family car, which her husband uses to transport firewood. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair a car

loans.name: Baktygul Saitova's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul S., 41, is the leader of this group. A resident of Nookat, a sunny, small town in Osh province in southern Kyrgyzstan, she has been employed for a rather long time in a regional military unit along with her husband, Nasirali. The couple has two children who are financially dependent on them. Being in the military for most of his life, Nasirali imposed upon his children a deep sense of devotion to and defense of the Motherland. It wasn’t surprising when their son decided to join the national army.

Baktygul is extremely proud of her children and hopes to provide the best conditions for their future education and employment. She is involved not only in her work in the military forces but also maintains the household well.

Baktygul keeps cattle and enjoys running a dairy. Six years ago she also started cultivating a small piece of land that they own and discovered the soil was very fertile. There always is a high demand for her fall harvest of vegetables and fruits, which helps Baktygul satisfy her family’s basic financial needs.

This spring Baktygul has grand plans to expand the variety of her crops, so she is in need of more funds than usual. She hopes Kiva will help her purchase mineral fertilizers. With her profits she plans on increasing her herd of cattle and purchasing a house.

About Mol Bulak:

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Rebecca Singit's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is 55 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Naganacan within Cauayan City, a part of Isabela province on the Mindanao islands. Rebecca raises pigs to fatten and sell. Rebecca has been in business for over twenty years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP every three months. Rebecca is also the group leader of a twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

In 2011, Rebecca joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Rebecca is requesting a loan, her first from ASKI, of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use any additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Gulmira Maksutalieva's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira M., 54, is the leader of this group. She is married, and her husband is an inspector for a local social fund. Twenty years of common life have gifted the couple with two daughters, the older of whom is now married and the younger, a student in college. She lives in the small town of Toktogul which is comprised of thousands of families like Gulmira’s. Gulmira herself is a kindergarten teacher, and together with her husband she breeds and resells cattle.

Seven years ago Gulmira used 7,000 KGS to purchase her first cow. Since then, she has managed to purchase nice furniture for the house and increase their heads of cattle. She is now applying for this loan in order to purchase additional cattle.

About Mol Bulak:

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S., 29, resides in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for high quality rice products. S. sells fruit, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3.25 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike to transport fruit to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fruit to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 51 year-old married woman with 7 children. Her oldest child is 28 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Elena is a farmer as well. She helps her husband till their land in Banga, South Cotabato. They grow rice and corn crops to sell to their community.

Elena requested a loan so she could purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs for their farm. Elena works hard to build a stable business. She also wishes for her children to be successful in their fields.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Din S. was born in 1962 and is a married woman who is blessed with four children. All four children are students in the local public school. Her husband, Din Ra, is 40 years old and works as a firewood seller in his village in Kompong Tom province. 

Din S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises pigs to earn a living. She has started to build a new house, but it is very difficult to save money and she has not yet been able to pay for construction costs. To solve this problem, Din S. is requesting her first loan to add to her savings and pay for the cost of building her house.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Duk S., 32, resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. S. sells traditional baskets, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is employed transporting construction materials, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. 
S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new truck to improve her husband’s business. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new truck to transport construction materials

loans.name: Jumagul's Group

texts.en:
Jumagul R., 39, is a leader of this group. She is a resident of the small town of Kadamjai in Batken Province of Kyrgyzstan. Jumagul is married and has three children, the oldest of whom is 16. Her husband is a tractor driver in a local farming community. Jumagul is a nurse in a village outpatient’s clinic. After getting married, she started to actively help her husband in managing agriculture since it was the main part of the family’s budget. Fifteen years of good management and hard work have brought the gift of a nice automobile for the family. Their monthly income is 3000 soms, and the loan is requested for purchasing seeds of potatoes. Jumagul’s dream is to get a good harvest this year and help her son with education fees.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en:
Elyn is a 28-year-old married woman from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She has a nine-year-old child.
Elyn is engaged in farming. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. They grow rice and corn crops that they sell to the market. Elyn helps on the farm but she spends most of her time running their sari-sari store and taking care of their child. She hopes to be able to sustain her child's education. Elyn's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ea

texts.en: Ea K., 48, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. K. is a farmer and sells fish, earning an income of about $6 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $56 USD on food and $35 USD on other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. K. appears in the photograph with her son.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fish to sell

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn D., 60, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. D. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about $3 USD each per day. Each month, the family has to spend $74 USD on food and $35 USD on other necessary expenses. D. is requesting a loan of $700 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a business as a motor-taxi driver. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver

loans.name: Chynygul Erkaeva's Group

texts.en:
Chynygul E., 27, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of the small southern town of Kadamjai. Chynygul is married and has three sons aged five, three and two months.
Chynygul had good teachers in her teenage years. Her parents were well-skilled farmers and they imparted practical skills to her from the age of 16 onwards.
Chynygul and her husband run a family business. They cultivate agricultural products such as vegetables, grain and fruits. Almost 90 per cent of Chynygul’s harvest is potatoes. It’s probably the main vegetable, along with onions and carrots, in use in main meat dishes. The couple use their business profits to help cover the costs associated with their children and household.
According to Kyrgyz tradition, a religious ritual has to be organized in honor of a toddler. Chynygul would like to invite many guests and organize a grand ceremony, but she’s worried that she has a lack of funds. Chynygul’s monthly income is 4,000 KGS. She and her group members applied for this loan because they are in urgent need of funds, and they know how to spend them wisely. Chynygul would like to purchase seed potatoes, which are a significant part of her crop cultivation. In the future, she wants to expand her land and sow more products.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: 59 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Sáp N. Thị (124) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Sáp is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 59-Quảng Hưng (18-1-59 Quảng Hưng).
Sáp is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, mainly selling confectionery products, in the local community. Sáp has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,600,000 VND per month from these activities.
In 2010, Sáp joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her second from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Sáp plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. H. Thị M. Thu (123) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. 2. N. Thị Hiên (125) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Sáp N. Thị (124) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Sáp là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 59-Quảng Hưng (18-1-59 Quảng Hưng). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Sáp thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Sáp kiếm được khoảng 1,600,000 VND. Vào 2010, Sáp đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Sáp đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. H. Thị M. Thu (123) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 2. N. Thị Hiên (125) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Klork

texts.en: Klork N. is a 27-year-old woman who earns a daily income by making a kind of Khmer cake. She makes about 2 USD in profit from her cake business. Her husband helps to support the family by selling recyclable materials. He buys many kinds of used goods, such as cans, bottles, plastics, and old electrical wires. He then sells these items in bulk to a wholesaler in another province or country. Klork N.’s husband uses a motorcycle to transport these recyclable items, but it is broken now. She would like a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace her husband's broken one so that he can pick up recyclable items for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport recyclable items

loans.name: 51 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Gia Đỗ Thị, a 53-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá, is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 51 Quảng Hưng (18.4.51 Quảng Hưng).

Gia, who is married and has four grown children, has been raising cattle for sale for over 10 years, earning approximately 2.000.000 VND a month. In 2009, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, she is now requesting her third loan for 6.000.000 VND for the same purpose. Gia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. L. Thị Thảo (66) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. N. Thị Tình (67) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Gia thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Gia kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, Gia đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Gia đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L.
